channel.title: Esports Kingdom
channel.description: Esports Kingdom contains articles, news, and views across multiple different esports games, focussed on weekly recaps and tournament previews/reviews.

item.title: Operation Riptide - Week 9 Challenges
item.description: "Nautical Mile" - As you can guess from the name we are going on some aquatic adventures this week. We will be sailing the seven seas to Shortdust, swimming on over to Blacksite, and eventually having a round of Guardian on Basalt.

item.title: Counter-Strike Tier Rankings: PGL Stockholm Major 2021
item.description: It was the first major in a long time and it allowed us to see all of the top international teams together on LAN going head-to-head for the most prestigious title in Counter-Strike. How do the teams stand against each other? Come and take a look!

item.title: Operation Riptide - Week 8 Challenges
item.description: "Midway" - As the name suggests, we are halfway through the Operation Riptide. This week we are going to be playing around on Inferno a lot with Competitive and Casual, as well as playing Arms Race and getting shotgun kills in Guardian.

item.title: Operation Riptide - Week 7 Challenges
item.description: "Land, Sea, and Air" - We are going to be completing missions all over the place this week. Water on Gaurdian Sirocco, flying in the air on Flying Scoutsman, and running around on the land in Dust2.

item.title: Operation Riptide - Week 6 Challenges
item.description: "Rumble in the Jungle" - It is time to go to the jungle and have some exotic animals show up. We will be going to Nuke for some Wingman, Blacksite for our weekly Guardian missions, and getting killstreaks in Deathmatch.

item.title: Operation Riptide - Week 5 Challenges
item.description: "Tropical Paradise" - We are going to be heading back into County to complete some tasks, win some rounds on Dust2, and get out the submachine guns to take on the Phoenix on Insertion II.

item.title: Counter-Strike Tier Rankings: IEM Fall 2021
item.description: After a series of amazing tournaments that decided who will be going to the major and who wasn't able to book their tickets to Stockholm - we sit down and analyse the results to come up with the next edition of our CSGO tier rankings!

item.title: Operation Riptide - Week 4 Challenges
item.description: "Gendarmerie" - it is time to lace up your boots and head over to Insertion II to win a game of Short Competitive, before getting kills all around Nuke, shotgun kills in the new Guardian mission, and early kills in Casual.

item.title: FURIA: "That happened is because the NA scene is dead pretty much"
item.description: Right after they claimed a spot at the Stockholm Major and ahead of their big clash with paiN, we got to talk to VINI from FURIA all about the North American scene, their rivalry with Team Liquid, and which teams he sees as coming up through the ranks.

item.title: ENCE: "We are very satisfied with the results, but we want more"
item.description: ENCE have begun to prove themselves as a top team and are making waves in the playoffs of back-to-back tournaments. Josh talks to them about their recent results, the 53 round game against OG, and how prepared they feel to go up against G2 tomorrow.

item.title: Astralis: "Everyone was just so tired and we were making stupid mistakes"
item.description: Josh got to sit down with the guys from Astralis and ask them questions. They talked about Lucky's rise and if he has proved his doubters wrong, their twin loses to Vitality at BLAST, and the meta-changing update of grenade dropping.

item.title: Operation Riptide - Week 3 Challenges
item.description: "Surf's Up" - No we are not about to surf around map unfortunately, but we are about to start Week 3 of challenges. This week you will be playing some Wingman on Ravine, graffitiing all over Dust2, and honing your sniper skills in a new Guardian mission.

item.title: Movistar: "We take these games the same as we did the other ones"
item.description: Everyone was a little shocked to see Movistar Riders make it this far, but now they have momentum behind them. We talk to mopoz, dav1g, and bladE about these unexpected results, the upcoming Major, and what it would mean to them and the organisation to qualify for it.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - North America Group B Preview
item.description: IEM Fall: North America starts today! On the line are five spots at the PGL Stockholm Major, and a chance to play on LAN against international opposition. Today, we take a look at Group B to see which teams are likely to advance out of the group, investigating their previous form and seeing how they stack up against the competition.

item.title: CPH Flames: "I think that the tier-two scene is getting stronger every single day"
item.description: Possibility the biggest surprise of IEM Fall, Copenhagen Flames, took some time to talk to us ahead of their playoffs run about how the tier-two scene differs from tier-one, their meteoric rise in this tournament, and the positive effect pita has had on the team.

item.title: NiP: "I only care about us and if we qualify or not"
item.description: They have secured their spot at the Stockholm Major and get a chance to raise the trophy in their home country, we talk to device, LNZ, and REZ from Ninjas in Pyjamas about the upcoming Major and the playoffs teams here at IEM Fall.

item.title: G2: "Going into the playoffs we will feel much more comfortable playing"
item.description: We don't know if they will be in the Legends Stage or not, but we know that the guys from G2 Esports will for sure be at the Stockholm Major later this year. We chat to nexa and NiKo and the return to LAN, and their expectations heading into playoffs and for the Major itself.

item.title: Fiend: "We came here without huge expectations, we were underdogs"
item.description: Ahead of their playoff match against Astralis, Team Fiend took some time to talk to the journalists about their performance so far in the tournament, their preparations for the best-of-three playoffs, and the pressure of possibly clinching a Major spot.

item.title: FaZe: "We have a second chance now and whatever happens, happens"
item.description: After some disappointing results, FaZe Clan have a second chance to qualify for the Stockholm Major, depending on their results in the upcoming matches. We talk to karrigan all about their results in the Group Stages, the format of IEM Fall, and the mentality of FaZe coming into the important matches for the Major spot.

item.title: BIG: "Every day we get to play an official game, I think we show a better BIG"
item.description: After they managed to clutch the 3rd place spot in their group we sat down with the players from BIG. We talk about gade coming into the team as an outsider, how he is adapting to the system and the best-of-one format of IEM Fall.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - North America Group A Preview
item.description: IEM Fall: North America is only days away, and it may be the most competitive tournament in the entire RMR circuit. With five slots at the PGL Stockholm Major on the line, the path to qualification has become simple: finish top five in this event, or miss the major.

item.title: Operation Riptide - Week 2 Challenges
item.description: "Seal The Deal" - The second week of Operation Riptide is underway and that means a new set of challenges for you. This week we are trying out the new map Basalt, defending Sirocco from an Amphibious Assault, and playing some Deathmatch.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - South America Preview
item.description: IEM Fall: South America will be the region's third Regional Major Rankings (RMR) tournament. Starting September 29th, four teams will compete for both RMR points and a prize pool of $10,000 USD. For two of them, this tournament means everything: nearly equal in points, whomever outperforms the other will secure South America's a spot at the PGL Stockholm Major.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - Oceania Preview
item.description: IEM Fall: Oceania is just around the corner. The event features Australia's four top teams competing for both a $10,000 prize pool and Regional Major Rankings points. Enough of these points will take a team to the PGL Stockholm Major, but only two squads are left in the running.

item.title: Renegades: "I feel like [AU CS scene] will bounce back next year"
item.description: Ahead of their campaign at IEM Fall 2021 Oceania we got to talk to the boys from Renegades competing against three of the other best teams in the region. We chat about their upcoming matches, their big focus for the tournament, and touch on the future of the Australian Counter-Strike scene.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - Europe Group D Preview
item.description: We conclude our preview of IEM Fall: EU by looking at Group D. Featuring both old names and new, these teams will compete in a round robin stage under best-of-one format to decide who will advance to the playoffs and who will see a premature elimination.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - Europe Group C Preview
item.description: IEM Fall: EU is only a few days away, and Group C is shaping up to be among the most competitive in any region. These six teams all enter the event with different pressures and motivators, but their goals remain the same: earn as many Regional Major Rankings points as possible, in a final attempt to reach the PGL Stockholm Major.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - Europe Group B Preview
item.description: Today, we take a look at the second of four groups participating in IEM Fall: EU. Group B will see six European squads fighting to obtain enough Regional Major Ranking (RMR) points to punch their ticket to the PGL Stockholm Major. The group contains a mix of Europe's very best, as well as several plucky rosters looking to turn heads and show what they're capable of.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - Europe Group A Preview
item.description: Only two European RMR events will be held in 2021, and the second is just days away. IEM Fall will see twenty-four of Europe's best teams playing for eleven qualification spots at the PGL Stockholm Major in October. This event will be the only one of all IEM Fall events to be played on LAN, giving us a chance to see how Europe's teams will perform in a return to offline play.

item.title: Operation Riptide - Week 1 Challenges
item.description: "Shark Week" - The new operation kicks off with a bang and a set of missions for you to complete and a maximum of 10 stars to earn towards your operation goals.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - CIS Group B Preview
item.description: Following up on our IEM Fall: CIS Group A preview, we're back to take a look at Group B. We'll be focusing on each team's past results and form headed into the tournament, seeing how they stack up against their competition en route to the PGL Stockholm Major. With only five qualification spots available, everyone will have to be at their best to beat out their regional rivals and book a ticket to the highly anticipated event.

item.title: IEM Fall 2021 - CIS Group A Preview
item.description: The CIS region will see its third and final Regional Major Rankings (RMR) tournament begin on September 29th. Set to be played out online, the five-day event will see twelve teams competing for just five spots at the highly anticipated PGL Stockholm Major. In this article, we'll focus on the six teams making up Group A, taking a look at their rosters, past results, and expectations headed into the tournament.

item.title: CSGO introduces a new case, 4 new weapon collections, and new stickers and patches
item.description: In the second part of today's Counter-Strike update, Valve added a bunch of new community content to the game. We have four brand new weapon collections (Train 2021, Mirage 2021, Dust2 2021, and Vertigo 2021) as well as 2 new sticker packs (Operation Riptide and Riptide Surf Shop) and a set of patches just for Operation Riptide.

item.title: New Maps and meta-changing weapon updates for Counter-Strike
item.description: In the first part of the update that Valve pushed out today for Counter-Strike, we see a massive change to Dust2, alongside gameplay update such as the addition of a riot shield and ability to drop grenades. This is a big one, you need to read all about it.

item.title: Counter-Strike's new operation - Operation Riptide
item.description: Get ready! Valve have release the next operation and it is called Operation Riptide. Inside it is some major gameplay updates, massive map changes, and a metric shit-tonne of new skins for weapons and agents. We take you through everything that is included in this series of articles to make sure you can get that diamond coin!

item.title: Counter-Strike Tier Rankings: ESL Pro League Season 14
item.description: Just as we thought that Gambit had solidified themselves at the top of the Counter-Strike game, a new challenger approached. Slowly Natus Vincere worked to prove that not only were they the best team in the CIS region, but they were the best CSGO team in the world.

item.title: mousesports: "I don't think that result from Cologne reflects our capability as a team"
item.description: We had the chance to talk to both dexter and the coach mithR from mousesports ahead of their ESL Pro League Season 14 Playoff campaign. Topics included the mentality with being behind and clawing your way to the playoffs and the effect the Cologne result had on the team just before the player's break.

item.title: Complexity: "I think our group was definitely a mess"
item.description: They came really far with a stand-in and we talk about that and more with the boys blameF, es3tag, and NaToSaphiX from Complexity. Expectations with a stand-in, going up against ZywOo and Vitality, as well as their group's weird results.

item.title: Vitality: "I don't really care what team we're facing"
item.description: Today we have a very special interview for you, because not only do we get to talk to apEX from Team Vitality about ESL Pro League and how they feel about their upcoming games, but we also get to talk to shox about his love for fishing and the little kisses he gives the carp.

item.title: OG: "The individuals shine on [Mirage] and that's why we find some success"
item.description: Aleksib & ruggah from OG were kind enough to sit down and give us some time to talk at ESL Pro League. We asked about their Mirage dominance at the moment, their preferred opponent in the Quarterfinals, and what it is about forZe that make them some a tricky team to beat.

item.title: NiP: "It's not the best, but it's out of my control"
item.description: Heading into the Group Stages of ESL Pro League we got to talk to the squad at Ninjas in Pyjamas about their situation surrounding the fifth player, the confidence boost of beating Gambit, and the future of the team.

item.title: Gambit: "I want revenge [against Vitality]"
item.description: We had the chance to talk to Hobbit and nafany from Gambit ahead of their Playoffs adventure at ESL Pro League about their tournament so far, their upcoming Quarterfinal, and their mentality after a tough loss like they had in the Group Stage.

item.title: NaVi: "We have three matches left to win this event"
item.description: We had the chance to have a short chat to the coach of Natus Vincere, B1ad3, about who they want to face in their quarterfinal matchup and what is motivating them throughout this tournament - winning their first Pro League or the Intel Grand Slam.

item.title: Team Liquid: "Just more time together, more practice in EU"
item.description: There was a small shock in the Group Stage of ESL Pro League Season 14 as Team Liquid made it out and in to the playoffs. We speak to Stewie2K & adreN about their preparations, if they expected to make it this far, and if they can go even further.

item.title: Heroic: "I don't think I've ever experienced such camaraderie in any team before"
item.description: Amidst noise from outside the game the players from Heroic take some time to talk to us about their preparations for ESL Pro League, which teams have surprised them so far in the tournament, and what it feels like to knock Astralis out of EPL.

item.title: forZe: "We are like beasts and we can rule the mountains"
item.description: We talked to Jerry and zorte from forZe ahead of their game against ENCE in the ESL Pro League Season 14. The topics we touched on included getting that crucial tier-one experience against the top teams and zorte's debut on a big stage.

item.title: Fnatic: "I'm confident that we can win [against Liquid]"
item.description: Fnatic are preparing to go up against Team Liquid in the first round of the ESL Pro League Season 14 group stage and we got some time to talk to them about going from a full Swedish roster into an international team, as well as their confidence levels coming into their game.

item.title: ENCE: "I would prefer to play NaVi out of all the teams, because I just want to beat simple"
item.description: For the first interview of ESL Pro League Season 14 both Grady and Josh sit down with the guys from ENCE to discuss the big differences between Tier-1 and Tier-2 Counter-Strike and the challenges to bust up into the top tier.

item.title: IEM Cologne Play-Off Teams: What do you think of Ancient?
item.description: All the teams had a chance to play Ancient in an official match at this point of the tournament so it felt fitting to see what the overall opinion was from the playoff teams to the new map. What did they like? What did they hate? and what would they like to change about it?

item.title: IEM Cologne Play-Off Teams: Which teams surprised you?
item.description: Before the playoffs we talked to all six teams featured; Astralis, NaVi, Gambit, VirtusPro, G2, and FaZe about which teams surprised them in this tournament. Either performed way better than they were expecting coming into it, or that underperformed and needed to pick up their game.

item.title: Counter-Strike Tier Rankings: IEM Cologne 2021
item.description: The first LAN event in over 16months, IEM Cologne, has come to a conclusion and now it is time to see where teams fall in our Tier Rankings. There has been some massive shake-ups as some teams surprise us with their performance and some teams underperformed in the recent event.

item.title: Heroic: "We don't want anybody who's not wanting to kick ass"
item.description: Ahead of their clash with Team Spirit, we got to talk to cadiaN, TeSeS, refrezh, stavn from Heroic alongside their mental coach Troels Robl and physiotherapist Kasper Straube. We get all of the insights about how the performance team helps out the squad in preparing for their games.

item.title: Astralis: "I was really aggressive before, but I think I've tuned down that a little bit"
item.description: In a brief session, Josh got to talk Bubzkji & Xyp9x from Astralis. They talked about the other Danish teams rising into the top echelon of CSGO teams, and how Bubzkji has adapted into the Astralis style after coming over from MAD Lions.

item.title: Virtus.Pro: "[Cologne] is the most important tournament even if it's not a major"
item.description: Coming off a tough tournament, we talked to YEKINDAR, Jame, and dastan from Virtus.Pro about how easy it is to reset mentally coming into IEM Cologne. We also get some insight into AVANGAR's 2019 run compared to their current run.

item.title: NaVi: "I feel like all our players finally feel the power that we have"
item.description: We talk to s1mple & b1ad3 from Natus Vincere about the other CIS teams that have shown great skill in the online era, the conditions that they have to play in their hotel rooms, and the important of the momentum from their win in the RMR tournament.

item.title: Team Liquid: "It's really hard to easily replace the chemistry"
item.description: There have been some roster changes since Team Liquid was at it's peak and we talk to EliGE about the difference of the variations, we also get adreN's opinion on skipping the play-in stage, and round it out with a talk about the best NA rising talent.

item.title: Gambit: "We need to create our meta because we're on the top"
item.description: We got a chance to talk to the top team in the world right now, Gambit. nafany gives us some insights on getting to the number one spot versus trying to stay there and then Hobbit chats to us about the differences between 2017 Gambit and this team.

item.title: G2 Esports: "There hasn't been any issues ever since I joined"
item.description: Directly into the Group Stage is G2 Esports and we talk about whether that is a positive or a negative with NiKo, huNter-, and JaCkz. We also talk to the cousins about playing together after 6months and to JaCkz about his time on the bench.

item.title: Vitality: "It's always tough to be that low when you were that high"
item.description: We got the chance to talk to apeX and misutaaa from Team Vitality before they have to play at IEM Cologne. We got to ask about what they need to do to reclaim the number one spot, what they think of Double Poney, and discuss momentum of winning your first games.

item.title: Team One: "We wanted to give a chance to a new Brazilian upcoming player"
item.description: People might be sleeping on Team One, but we got the chance to talk to malbsMd, pesadelo, and righi before they compete at IEM Cologne. We talked about the addition of xns, the difference of playing in Europe, and how they have found Ancient so far.

item.title: MIBR: "We have a potential to be the best Brazilian team"
item.description: We have seen some changes around MIBR and Josh and Grady delve into that with yel, exit, and Apoka to find out the biggest changes of exist joining, their feeling surrounding the RMR reset, and how they view the entire Brazilian scene.

item.title: mousesports: "We wanted to go with a younger lineup"
item.description: Grady and Josh get the chance to talk to ropz, Bymas, dexter, and mithR from mousesports ahead of their IEM Cologne adventure about bringing dexter in as the IGL, Bymas' expectations around a tier-one LAN, and what their goals are here at the tournament.

item.title: Team LDLC: "With Keoz and Maka I feel like we are more on the same page"
item.description: What is going through Team LDLC's head as they prepare for IEM Cologne? We chat to hAdji, Keoz, and SIXER about this lineup and their recent rosters changes, preparing for a LAN tournament, and compare the current lineup to ones from the past few years.

item.title: FaZe: "I think it's one of the best iterations of FaZe"
item.description: FaZe Clan have seen a drop in the rankings lately and are looking to prove that their current line-up can stand with the titans of Counter-Strike right now. We talk to rain & karrigan about their aspirations, how this roster compares to previous ones, and what the rankings mean to them.

item.title: Renegades: "Just the experience alone is invaluable for team improvement"
item.description: With the new lineup this is Renegades' first time in getting to go up against the stronger European teams and they are not taking it lightly. We talk to malta and their coach KingFisher about who is coming up through the Australian scene, their recent rosters changes, and what competing in Europe again means to them.

item.title: FURIA: "I don't feel happy about our past performances overall"
item.description: What is honda's expectations for himself coming back into the roster? Are FURIA happy with their recent results in tournaments? What is arT's mentality when it comes to winning and losing? We chat to FURIA to get all of these answers and more.

item.title: BIG: "You can't really fix your mistakes because you have tournament after tournament"
item.description: We sit down with tabseN, tiziaN, and k1to from BIG to talk about what they need to do as a team to get back to the number one spot, what it is like when they clash against their fellow Germans in Sprout, and the pressures of an insane tournament schedule.

item.title: Bad News Bears: "Every single team we're going to play thinks we're garbage"
item.description: Bad News Bears are the saviours of NACS and looking to make a big impact here at IEM Cologne. We talk to Shakezullah, ptr, and Jonji about being orgless, their aims with the team and recent roster movements, and the sweet sweet merch!

item.title: Overwatch Tier Rankings: 2021 June Joust
item.description: We have had the May Melee, and we have just concluded the June Joust that saw a predictable final two teams in Dallas Fuel and Shanghai Dragons. Before the Summer Showdown starts let's put out a new edition of our Tier Rankings.

item.title: The Path to Stockholm: The Spring RMR Recap
item.description: With only three chances to earn points leading up to Stockholm, each map matters and only those with consistent top level performances will get to dance with the best of the best once October rolls around.

item.title: Overwatch Tier Rankings: 2021 May Melee
item.description: The first mini-tournament of the 2021 Overwatch League season has come to a conclusion with a surprising Dallas Fuel win propelling them to the top of our Tier Rankings alongside two other teams while we see many squads drop down the tiers.

item.title: Call of Duty Tier Rankings: 2021 Stage Three
item.description: Stage 2 got a little spicy in the middle, but then Stage 3 brought it back to some normalcy. We take a look at all of the Call of Duty League teams and where they fall on our tier list now that we are over halfway through.

item.title: Astralis teammates comment on device's shocking departure
item.description: Yesterday it was announced that after 5 years at the top of the game the Astralis core would be shattered as device would be heading over to Ninjas in Pyjamas. This left the CSGO world ratted, but none more than his teammates who all commented on his exit.

item.title: Overwatch Tier Rankings: 2021 Pre-Season
item.description: The 2021 Season for the Overwatch League is just about to kick off so Zekzal takes a look at how the teams stack up before the action begins in a special pre-season edition of the Overwatch Tier Rankings.

item.title: Counter-Strike Tier Rankings: ESL Pro League Season 13
item.description: ESL Pro League came to the conclusion with Gambit Esports taking out Heroic in the grand finals to cement themselves at the top of the Counter-Strike world right now. It isn't who we expected to be standing on the pedestal, but they are!

item.title: Pentanet.GG Wins Inaugural League of Legends Circuit Oceania Grand Final
item.description: Esports fans tuned in to watch Pentanet.GG claim a 3-1 Victory against Peace and secure themselves a trip to Iceland for the Riot Games' Mid-Season Invitational this May.

item.title: The Spring Showdown 2021 in CS:GO: waiting for the fire and the unexpected battles
item.description: Fans found the last participant of the spring championship Blast Premier Spring Showdown 2021 on March 30. It was the ambitious American team Extra Salt. The guys headed by Edgar MarKE Maldonado won the final match at the event VENN and now, they will be fighting for 162 thousand US dollars of prize money.

item.title: DreamHack Masters Spring 2021: Under the May downpour of bullets
item.description: The organizers begin warming the interest for the championship DreamHack Masters, which starts at the end of April. First of all, they announced the prize pool of 250 thousand US dollars.

item.title: San Francisco Shock: The measuring stick of the league
item.description: With the 2021 Overwatch League Season starting just around the corner, the San Francisco Shock have their sights set on adding a third championship to their trophy cabinet and solidifying their dynasty within Overwatch Esports.

item.title: Bringing The paiN: NA Dreamhack Open March 2021 Recap
item.description: March’s Dreamhack Open pitted eight North American teams against one-another, for both a share of the $70,000 prize pool as well as a qualification spot at IEM Summer, hosted in Europe.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 16 Challenges
item.description: "Ancient Danger" - The last week of missions and that means it is time to wrap it up with another co-op mission and a whole lot of action on the map Ancient including Guardian and Competitive.

item.title: A Scene Rebuilding: My 2021 NA CS Recap
item.description: Ever since the collapse of NA CS, it's been pretty clear that a lot of people see it as a dead region. I, however, have hope: there is potential here, and teams have already begun rebuilding. As such, I've decided to do a little recap of some of the NA teams on the rise and some of the past/upcoming tournaments.

item.title: Counter-Strike Tier Rankings: IEM Katowice 2021
item.description: We are switching back into global rankings for this edition as IEM Katowice saw teams from most of the major regions go head-to-head. What does this mean for the Europe old guard, the dying North American scene, and the new fresh crop of CIS talent?

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 15 Challenges
item.description: "Spare No Expense" - It's the second to last week of the operation and it's time to spend your hard earned cash as you enter Danger Zone for the first time in this Operation. Also you will be making that dollar dollar in Deathmatch.

item.title: ESL and AOC team up to bring VALORANT Rising Heroes tournament to ANZ!
item.description: VALORANT Rising Heroes presented by AOC is the largest VALORANT esports tournament that the ANZ scene has seen yet with $24,000aud on the line in cash and prizes. It will see open qualifiers, a 16-team tournament, and a group stage live from ESL's brand new studios in Sydney.

item.title: Call of Duty Tier Rankings: 2021 Stage One
item.description: The first stage of the 2021 season of the Call of Duty League has been completed and competition is heating up at the top. Stage Two will be an interesting one to see which teams can keep their grip on the top and which fall down a tier or two.

item.title: The World of Tanks ANZ Premier League Season 2 kicks off next week
item.description: Friday the 12 March is when you should tune in to the World of Tanks ANZ twitch channel to see eight teams from across New Zealand and Australia represent their city/state for a share of the $20,000 prizepool. There's also a really fun showmatch tomorrow!

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 14 Challenges
item.description: "Turf War" - There isn't a huge theme this week, instead you will be playing some Wingman with your friends while trying to get some kills either scoped, with the enemies weapons, or from very specific locations on the map.

item.title: FURIA: "I’ve never played anything like it, it’s just all reactionary based"
item.description: At IEM Katowice 2021 we got the opportunity to talk to both VINI and, the brand new American to the squad, junior from FURIA about what makes their team so special, can they perform at a major, and junior's experience so far.

item.title: Astralis: "It isn’t the same as when you are playing in the arena"
item.description: Before they were knocked out in the play-offs, we got to sit down with Bubzkji and gla1ve from Astralis. We chatted about the difference with shifting to online and how Bubzkji felt moving into a team like Astralis.

item.title: Heroic: "We need to take a step back and then we’ll be ready to take two steps forward"
item.description: We manage to get a hold of three of the players from Heroic - stavn, b0RUP, and TeSeS - during IEM Katowice 2021. We talked about their performance of late compared to last year, the burn out of online play, and how they can come back stronger for the upcoming tournaments and major.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 13 Challenges
item.description: "Vertiglobals" - Don't be scared away from the title of this week, but yes we are going to be spending a lot fo time on Vertigo. This week has it all Casual Vertigo, Wingman Vertigo, and Guardian Vertigo!

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 12 Challenges
item.description: "Delirium" - It is getting crazy up in here and that might be from the crazy weather outside or the missions we have this week. I hope you like using the Scout and the map Dust II because you are going to be seeing a lot of them.

item.title: Hey PGL, we have a great showmatch idea for you!
item.description: It is November 2013, over 7 years ago, and the first ever Counter-Strike: Global Offensive Major is coming to a thrilling conclusion. The Elmia in Jönköping is getting it's roof blown off by two local teams tearing it up in the grand finals.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 11 Challenges
item.description: "One Track Mind" - Choo choo...it is time to visit the map they call Train for all of our missions this week. It is rounds in Competitive, kills on Guardian, headshots in Deathmatch, and heavy weapon kills in Casual - but all on Train.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 10 Challenges
item.description: "Near Sighted" - It is all about the kills and round wins this week across multiple different game modes. It isn't just any ordinary kills, you have to get kills on enemies that are extremely close to you in both Guardian and Deathmatch.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 9 Challenges
item.description: "Keep Your Eyes Open" - You might be finished with Ancient, but it isn't finished with you as you have one more mission left on that map before you head off to blind people, graffiti on Dust II, and shoot some bots in the head.

item.title: Call of Duty Tier Rankings: 2021 Pre-Season KickOff
item.description: The 2021 Season for the Call of Duty League has kicked off! Officially the results form this week don't factor into the season rankings, but we used it as a chance to see how the teams stack up in the pre-season.

item.title: Gabe Newell says DOTA2's The International possibly coming to New Zealand
item.description: A local news outlet in New Zealand recently conducted an interview with Gabe Newell and he revealed that DOTA2's The International might be coming to the Kiwi shores. It is a very "realistic possibility" according to the co-founder of Valve.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 8 Challenges
item.description: "Welcome to the Jungle" - Go and find yourself some Roses, but we already have the Guns. This week you are going to have to work hard in Dust2 and Retakes, while get some Shotgun kills and being a little vandal all over Ancient.

item.title: Voting is now open for the first ever OCCA Awards
item.description: Nominations have now closed and voting is open for the first ever OCCA Awards - recognising the hard working esports players, teams, and casters in Oceania. Find out how to vote, what each of the categories are, and when to tune in to see the results!

item.title: Counter-Strike Majors are back on the menu!
item.description: PGL have just announced that they will be hosting the first Counter-Strike Major in 2 years at the end of this year and we have all of the details they revealed about it so far.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 7 Challenges
item.description: "Improvise" - I really hope that you love the map Nuke because that is where you are going to be spending a lot of time this week and you will be shooting a lot of SMGs at people in all of Deathmatch, Arms Race, and Guardian!

item.title: Anda Seat partners with Marvel to launch its Avengers gaming chairs
item.description: Anda Seat have cemented a name for themselves in the industry through their impressive work manufacturing racing car seats for prestigious brands, now partnering with Disney and Marvel to immortalise the legacy of your favourite characters such as Captain America, Iron Man, Spider-Man, and Ant-Man.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 6 Challenges
item.description: "World Tour" - Are you ready to feel like a rockstar? This week you will be spending your time in Vertigo and Mirage playing your sweet tunes for the players in Wingman, Deathmatch, Demolition, and as always Guardian.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 5 Challenges
item.description: "Sleight of Hand" - This week it is your turn to do some magic tricks in Counter-Strike. You will be doing classic like the Cup And Balls on Mirage, while also trying to keep some secrets to yourself on Nuke by covering them up with some smoke grenades.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 4 Challenges
item.description: "Full-Time Job" - This week our focuses shift from specific types of weapons into workplace-themed puns. You will have to get kills with the M249, earn money, and deal grenade damage to make sure you get the maximum amount of stars possible this week.

item.title: Competitive Oceanic League of Legends is BACK!
item.description: Today ESL Gaming and Guinevere Capital announced a new partnership that will see a new competitive league for Oceanic League of Legends operate in 2021.

item.title: Razer gears up for SEA games 2021 esports event
item.description: As Razer once again solidifies the official inclusion of esports in the 31st SEA Games, it reaffirms commitment to championing esports in the region.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 3 Challenges
item.description: "Rangefinder" - It is all about the long range kills and the Sniper Rifles this week as you try to get 6 out of the 11 stars available to you across the Competitive, Guardian, Deathmatch, and Arms Race gamemodes.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 2 Challenges
item.description: "Moon Shot" - I hope you like the map Apollo, because we are going to space and getting kills with pistols and winning rounds. Hopefully you are also the most valuable player on your team if you Broken Fang Premier.

item.title: Operation Broken Fang - Week 1 Challenges
item.description: "Start Your Engines" - It has been a long time since we have had an Operation, but Operation Broken Fang has just dropped and that means we are here to help you get the Diamond Coin with all of the missions.

item.title: How has Esports changed in the last 20 years according to the ESL Founders
item.description: Big congratulations goes out to ESL for their 20th anniversary and a big thanks for inviting us out to their press conference. 4 of the Founders of ESL were on deck and gave us their opinions on how the Esports world has changed in the last 20 years.

item.title: Adding Fuel to the Fuel: A Dallas Fuel 2021 Roster Analysis
item.description: With the owner of the Dallas Fuel and Team Envy, Mike 'Hastr0' Rufail, announcing on Twitter the Dallas Fuel roster - fans and analysts alike were excited for the prospects of the team in 2021. Kevin Rathore breaks down each player and rates the team's chances of walking out of 2021 with a trophy.

item.title: League of Legends Tier Rankings: Worlds 2020
item.description: We are back with a special edition of our League of Legends tier rankings. Since Worlds 2020 showed us the first glimpse of cross-region competition we have brought together our rankings into a big one-off World Tier Rankings!

item.title: Counter-Strike Tier Rankings: ESL Pro League Season 12 (and more!)
item.description: It has been 2months since we last looked at which teams are the strongest in their region for Counter-Strike and a lot has happened. Most notably ESL Pro League Season 12 has concluded across the regions!

item.title: Overwatch Tier Rankings: Overwatch League Playoffs
item.description: The Overwatch League for 2020 wrapped up recently with a grand champion across the regions being crowned. We take a look at the entire season and place the teams on our tier rankings for the last time in 2020!

item.title: Dota2 Tier Rankings: ESL One, OMEGA League, OGA Dota PIT, BTS Pro Series, and more
item.description: There have been a bunch of events in the DOTA2 esports space including ESL One Thailand, the OMEGA League, OGA Dota PIT Season 3, and the BTS Pro Series. Where do all of the teams stack up now?

item.title: League of Legends Tier Rankings: Summer Seasons 2020
item.description: The road to Worlds is coming to an end as all of the seasons wrap up. We have a bunch of national champions from their regions and a bunch of other teams that have also squeezed through to Worlds - but how do they all stack up?

item.title: Sim-Racer Flynn Mullany: "You do miss out on that g-force and the wind"
item.description: Today we get to tell the story of 18 year old sim-racer (and real racer) Flynn Mullany. We talk about how Flynn got his start at 12 years old in go-karts, broke into the esports scene when he was underage, and is now racing in Formula 4 - both in the video games and on the track.

item.title: AVANT Clash with Kevo: "Never have curved edges for a phone if you are going to do esports"
item.description: We had the opportunity to talk with, mobile esports player turned content creator, Kevin from Clash with Kevo. We talked about his experience in the Red Bull MEO World Finals, his 11k subscriber YouTube channel, and the ins-and-outs of mobile esports.

item.title: Counter-Strike Tier Rankings: ESL One Cologne (and more!)
item.description: One of the biggest tournaments of the Counter-Strike year, ESL One Cologne, has come to an end and it has been awhile since our last Tier Rankings. It seems like the perfect time to dust them off and try to place the teams based on where they stack up in their region.

item.title: ESL and NetEase launch mobile MOBA game MARVEL Super War in ANZ
item.description: We talk to Ben Green from ESL Australia about working with NetEase to launch the mobile MOBA game MARVEL Super War in Australia & New Zealand, setting up a long-term competitive ecosystem, and the rise of mobile esports.

item.title: Call of Duty Tier Rankings: CoD League Championship
item.description: Congratulations to Dallas Empire for taking out the 2020 Call of Duty League Championship! That brings the 2020 season to a close and as such we have one final tier rankings to see where the teams ended up, featuring some surprising down-ranks.

item.title: Rainbow Six Tier Rankings: Season 1 Stage 1
item.description: The first stage of Season 1, with a few hiccups, is completed and we have multiple champions from across all of the regions. So Grady and Cthulhu got together to try and place over 100 teams into tier rankings based on their performance in their region.

item.title: Overwatch Tier Rankings: Overwatch League Countdown (Weeks 24-27)
item.description: The Countdown Cup has come to end and once again the Shanghai Dragons and San Francisco Shock rise up to the top spots in their respective region - but how do the rest of the teams stack up in the tier rankings?

item.title: Dota2 Tier Rankings: OGA Dota PIT, BEYOND EPIC, BTS Pro Series, and more
item.description: There have been a bunch of regional tournaments in the past few months hosted by OGA Dota PIT, BEYOND EPIC, BTS Pro Series and other awesome TOs. It feels like a good time for the next edition of our Dota2 Tier Rankings!

item.title: CSGO introduces the Fracture Case with 17 brand new weapon skins
item.description: Alongside the brand new weapon case, called the Fracture Case, we also have some other stuff. There is networking improvements and updates to all three of Swamp, Mutiny, and Anubis.

item.title: VALORANT Patch 1.05, New Agent! New Battlepass! New Ranked System! New Gamemode!
item.description: Today a massive patch for VALORANT dropped that included a brand new agent called Killjoy as well as Act 2 bringing with it a rank-reset, new battlepass, and more ranking indicators.

item.title: VictorEsports: What are Esports? (Tauranga Armageddon 2020)
item.description: Hard-hitting investigative journalist VictorEsports hits the streets of Armageddon Expo Tauranga 2020. He brings with himself a camera crew and one question - Esports, what are they?

item.title: ESL and Psyonix announce ESL Rocket League Oceanic Championship
item.description: Today, in partnership, ESL Australia and Psyonix announce the ESL Rocket League Oceanic Championship. An online tournament series with a prize-pool of a combined $225,000 across three splits running from Aug 2020 to Apr 2021.

item.title: Call of Duty Tier Rankings: CoD League Weeks 11-13
item.description: The Regular Season is completed as now we know how the CoD League teams will be seeded going into the Playoffs. Two teams take the top spot in S-Tier as well as the top seeding right into the Quarterfinals.

item.title: VALORANT Patch Notes 1.04, Agent updates and polish!
item.description: This week we get a brand new patch for VALORANT with changes for a number of heroes, the biggest of which will affect Viper and Brimstone mains who will have to adjust their playstyle a little. The weapons get a little bit of love as well with changes for the Classic.

item.title: Overwatch Tier Rankings: Overwatch League Summer (Weeks 19-22)
item.description: Summer Showdown came down to a exciting finish with two new teams in the Paris Eternal and Guangzhou Charge picking up the victories for their regions. What has this done for the overall landscape of our Overwatch League tier rankings?

item.title: League of Legends Tier Rankings: Mid-Season Summer 2020
item.description: We are roughly halfway into the Summer season for the LCK, LPL, LEC, and LCS. That means it is time for Grady and Ryan to put their heads together and come up with another edition of the Tier Rankings to put the teams where they belong!

item.title: CSGO Regional Tier Rankings: DreamHack Masters Spring
item.description: DreamHack Masters Spring has come to a close and we have a better idea about how the Counter-Strike teams all stack up in their respective regions. So Grady and Phoebe got together for another edition of the CSGO Tier Rankings!

item.title: Mission Control's Austin Smith: "Our focus is on community building and social experience"
item.description: After reporting on Mission Control's partnership with the Special Olympics, we had the chance to sit down with Austin Smith, the Co-Founder and CEO, to talk about what Mission Control is, the cool partnerships that have forged, and what they are doing to build communities.

item.title: Mission Control announces partnership with Special Olympics New York and Oregon
item.description: Mission Control, a rec league gaming platform that allows workplaces, community centers, and college clubs to conduct their own esports leagues, announced today a partnership with Special Olympics New York and Oregon, in which athletes will use the Mission Control platform to compete in leagues playing Rocket League.

item.title: VALORANT Patch Notes 1.02, Competitive Mode!
item.description: Major changes to VALORANT coming forward this patch, with Competitive Mode going live, changes to tagging and much, much more.

item.title: Overwatch League Week 21 - Hero Bans and Match-ups
item.description: Overwatch League has changed it's format a little with the lack of a hero pool this week. They will also be missing a hero pool during the Summer Showdown next week. Other than the hero pools, we do have all of the details around what games to expect this week!

item.title: Call of Duty Tier Rankings: CoD League Weeks 9 & 10
item.description: We had another two weeks of Call of Duty League competition and it is time for another edition of our Tier Rankings. We see a new team leap into S-Tier while multiple other previously-strong teams slip downwards towards the bottom of the rankings.

item.title: Overwatch League Week 20 - Hero Bans and Match-ups
item.description: The hero bans for Week 20 of the Overwatch League might be very familiar, but the 13 huge match-ups we have this week are brand new and we have the time-converted start times for you!

item.title: Overwatch League Week 19 - Hero Bans and Match-ups
item.description: The Overwatch league is back with Week 19 and it's Summer Showdown. We had just wrapped May Melee and then took a few weeks off to allow for the teams to rest and now it is time for a return. We have all the details about Week 19 right here!

item.title: Dota2 Tier Rankings: ESL One Birmingham 2020 Online
item.description: ESL One Birmingham 2020 just came to an end and now we have a perspective about how the teams from South East Asia, China, Europe + CIS, and the Americas stack up against one-another. That means it is time to break our our Tier Rankings for Dota2!

item.title: BLAST Premier Spring American Showdown - Playoffs Preview
item.description: The BLAST Premier Spring Regular Season has concluded and we saw Team Liquid being the only American team to place high and earn a spot in the American Finals. Now it is time for the American Showdown with 6 remaining teams fighting for 3 spots alongside Team Liquid.

item.title: Razer's David Tse: "We have a vision to establish esports in Olympics Games"
item.description: After the announcement of the Razer Southeast Asian Invitational 2020 Grady got some time to talk to David Tse, the Global Esports Director at Razer, about what is in Razer's esports future, the games they chose, and how the current situation helps/hinders esports.

item.title: Chiefs zewsy & ofnu: "We wanted to to start new, start something different"
item.description: From the Vault - IEM Sydney 2019. Back when the dynamic Kiwi duo of zewsy & ofnu were both on Chiefs, Grady got some time to sit down and talk to both of them about what happened with Tainted Minds/ICON, how horrible the Australian internet infrastructure is, and the dream of once walking out onto the stage.

item.title: ESL One Birmingham China - Playoffs Preview
item.description: 8 of the best Chinese Dota2 teams, including 6 direct invites and 2 form the closed qualifier are currently playing in the ESL One Birmingham tournament. They are down to the top 4 and we take a look at their chances in the playoffs and what match-ups we are getting in the first round.

item.title: ESL One Birmingham South East Asia - Playoffs Preview
item.description: The ESL One Birmingham Dota2 event might have lost it's LAN, but it hasn't lost it's momentum. The tournament moved online and now we take a look at 4 of the top teams from the South East Asia region who have made it to the playoffs for the region.

item.title: Overwatch Tier Rankings: Overwatch League May (Weeks 12-16)
item.description: May Melee has finished with San Francisco Shock winning the North American competition and the Shanghai Dragons winning the Asian competition. That means it is time for us to get out our pens and paper to assess the Overwatch League teams for another edition of the tier rankings.

item.title: Call of Duty Tier Rankings: CoD League Weeks 1-8
item.description: As the Call of Duty League ramps up it felt like a good time to launch of fifth game in our Tier Rankings series. We have enlisted the help of Coy DePratt to help our usual suspect Grady to place the 12 teams into 5 tiers based on their recent performance.

item.title: All of the OWL players who retired in 2020 and who moved to VALORANT
item.description: There has been a large exodus lately of current and former Overwatch pros retiring from the OWL. We take a look at 6 players who were playing in the 2020 OWL season and have since retired, some of them to try their hand at VALORANT. Also features 8 other OWL players from the 2019 season.

item.title: League of Legends Tier Rankings: Spring Seasons 2020
item.description: With the conclusion of all the Spring Seasons in league of Legends, it is time for another Tier Rankings. Since esports is moving to a more regional-based system and the Mid-Season Invitational wont be happening this year, we have ranked each of the LCK, LEC, LPL, and LCS individually.

item.title: Razer announces Southeast Asian Invitational 2020
item.description: Starting on June 22, teams from across the 10 competing SEA nations will go head-to-head in three different games, to prepare for the Southeast Asian Games next year, thank to Razer's Southeast Asian Invitational 2020 tournament.

item.title: Road to Rio Europe - Playoffs Preview
item.description: The most hotly contest region for Counter-Strike has just finished the Group Stages of their European leg of the Road to Rio. It saw some big name teams miss out on the Playoffs and some unknown teams get a chance in the spotlight.

item.title: Road to Rio CIS - Playoffs Preview
item.description: Natus Vincere didn't make it out of the Group Stages - that is the biggest shocker of the CIS leg on the Road to Rio. To be fair, forZe also failed to make it out of the Group Stages, so the six teams we profile heading into the Playoffs is full of dark horses.

item.title: Overwatch League Week 15 - Hero Bans and Match-ups
item.description: It is yet again another week in the OverWatch League and that means that we have a brand new set of Hero Bans and Match-ups for you. Come and see which heroes will not be appearing this week and what time your favorite teams will face off.

item.title: Road to Rio Oceania - Playoffs Preview
item.description: There was only four teams playing in the Oceania division on the Road to Rio, but that doesn't mean the competition wasn't strong. We know which team advances straight into the Grand Finals and which two have to fight once more for the other slot.

item.title: Road to Rio Asia - Playoffs Preview
item.description: The top eight teams from across China, East Asia, SouthEast Asia, and the Middle East came together to see who would reign supreme in the Asia region on the Road to Rio. We are down to four and Esports Kingdom takes a look at who has the best chance to get the victory.

item.title: Overwatch League Week 14 - Hero Bans and Match-ups
item.description: The overWatch League have settled on the 4 heroes that will be banned during Week 14 of the OverWatch League as well as the 12 match-ups for the week spread across two days. We have all the details including times, teams, and banned heroes.

item.title: Road to Rio North America - Playoffs Preview
item.description: After the group stages that saw one team disband and drop out entirely, and two of the stronger teams in Evil Geniuses and MIBR fail to make the top 3 in the group - we take a look at the six teams that made it to the playoffs of the North American Road to Rio.

item.title: Renegades edge out Cringe Society to win Oceania Rocket League Spring Series
item.description: After some controversy, the Renegades missed out on playing the playoffs of the RLCS Season 9 Oceanic Championship. Now back for revenge the Renegades take out three of the four teams that placed above them on their way to the Oceania Rocket League Spring Series championship.

item.title: The International delayed, likely until next year
item.description: Valve just announced that due to the current COVID-19 pandemic that is sweeping across the esports world, the Dota 2 event 'The International' is going to be delayed. What will happen with the Battle Pass, prize-pool, and when will it be delayed until?

item.title: Twitch introduce an Esports Directory
item.description: Twitch has always been a destination for both video game streamers and esports events, both categories of stream were competing for views. Today Twitch announced the Esports Directory that will make it easier to find esports content.

item.title: ESL and DreamHack enter streaming deal with Twitch
item.description: ESL and DreamHack today announced a three-year deal with Twitch. The agreement will see some of the biggest esports tournaments organized by ESL and DreamHack live streamed to the service exclusively on Twitch in 2021 and 2022.

item.title: Competitive mode and ranked matchmaking amongst VALORANT Patch 0.49 updates
item.description: Three weeks after the beta release of VALORANT and the improvements are coming in hot and fast. The headliners for Patch 0.49 are the competitive mode and ranked matchmaking - which have both been added and are just waiting to go live.

item.title: sinatraa departs San Francisco Shock, heading for VALORANT
item.description: San Francisco Shock player sinatraa shocked the esports world today by announcing that they retiring from professional Overwatch and is heading for brand new pastures of VALORANT. sinatraa was the MVP of Season 2 of the Overwatch League where The Shock won the championship.

item.title: Pentanet.GG makes changes after conclusion of OPL Split 1
item.description: Pentanet.GG narrowly missed out on a playoffs spot in the Oceanic Pro League Split 1 with a 6th place finish. Today that announced that they are making rosters changes with one player heading to the bench and a new one coming on over from Gravitas.

item.title: FunPlus Phoenix Worlds skins and more in League of Legends Patch 10.9
item.description: Six months after the conclusion of Worlds 2019, the FunPlus Phoenix skins are finally entering the game in Patch 10.9. The patch also sees buffs for Cho'Gath, Fiddlesticks, Gnar, Kayn, Lissandra, and Quinn as well as nerfs for Bard, Karthus, Nami, Tundle, and Wukong.

item.title: Counter-Strike coach kassad leaves 100 Thieves
item.description: The coach of 100 Thieves' Counter-Strike roster, kassad, has left the organisation after being with the Australian squad since 2017. kassad has released a statement and listed his reasons for departing 100 Thieves and leaving the boys coach-less.

item.title: 16 teams invited to €30,000 BLAST Rising tournament
item.description: BLAST Rising is a 16-team online tournament, based out of Europe, that is aimed at the up-and-coming teams trying to make a splash. These teams will play 55 matches across two weeks for the chance to win their chunk of the €30,000 prizepool.

item.title: Overwatch League Week 13 - Hero Bans and Match-ups
item.description: Blizzard have now announced the 4 heroes who will be banned during Week 13 play in their Overwatch League. We also know what the 10 match-ups will be for the week and exactly what times you can catch them live.

item.title: HellRaisers assemble new squad, Flarich returns
item.description: Today HellRaisers, who had benched their entire roster back in April, announce their new 5-man team that they will use as early as tomorrow for ESEA MDL Season 34. It includes Flarich coming back off the bench, a Major veteran, 2 Russians, and a Lithuanian.

item.title: G2 have flawless Grand Final to win North American Rocket League Spring Series
item.description: After an abysmal last place finish in Season 8 of the Rocket League Championship, G2 Esports have turned it all around. They captured the Season 9 victory and just now captured the Spring Series win after a flawless 4-0 grand final against NRG.

item.title: Overwatch Tier Rankings: Overwatch League Weeks 1-11
item.description: We have had tier rankings for Counter-Strike, League of Legends, and Rainbow Six, now it is time to branch into Overwatch. In this first edition of the Overwatch Tier Rankings we place all of the OWL teams (and some Contenders teams) into S, A, B, C, or D-Tier based on their current skill-level.

item.title: CSGO Regional Tier Rankings: EPL Season 11 & Flashpoint Season 1
item.description: Continuing the trend with our Tier Rankings, we have now shifted into region-based rankings for the meantime while the esports world is also moving to more separate divisions. Come and see who the best Counter-Strike teams in Europe, the Americas, CIS, and Asia-Pacific are!

item.title: Rainbow Six Regional Tier Rankings: Pro League Season 11
item.description: The current COVID-19 pandemic has forced changes in the esports world and as it gets pushed towards regional competitions, Esports Kingdom also has to adapt and move our tier rankings temporarily towards regional tier rankings. So come and see how each team stacks up in their regions!

item.title: Renegades nexa: "I still think I need more time to adjust to the playstyle of an IGL"
item.description: From the Vault - IEM Sydney 2017. Back in 2017 nexa wasn't on G2 Esports like he is now, he was on the Australian team Renegades. Grady got some time to talk to him about how he got into Counter-Strike, what it is like fitting into a new team, and what he does outside of the game.

item.title: League of Legends Tier Rankings: Middle of Spring Seasons
item.description: We are roughly halfway through most of the Spring seasons in the League of Legends leagues. So it is time for Ryan and Grady to get together once again and try to collate all of the teams together into a tier rankings. Unfortunately because of the lack of play, we have had to skip LPL for this edition.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 16 Challenges
item.description: "Time To Take Out The Trash" - Finally after 16 weeks of waiting, Valve give the players another co-op mission. This time you must destroy a Phoenix production facility and eliminate Franz Kriegeld. You can also get the Diamond Coin now if you get all possible stars.

item.title: We got invited to the MSI Gaming ANZ laptop launch
item.description: This week Grady got invited out to MSI's New Zealand launch of their new suite of laptops - both for gaming and content creation. Take a look at some of the photos Grady took and learn a little bit about what hardware was on show.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 15 Challenges
item.description: "Light Buy" - As the name would suggest, you are not going to be using any rifles this week. The missions revolve around holding on to money, spending as little as possible, and getting kills with cheaper guns like the UMP-45.

item.title: CSGO adds patches for agents, buy menu changes, and crosshair customization/sharing
item.description: Valve just pushed a major update for Counter-Strike: Global Offensive that has added 21 patches to the game that you can equip to your agents in one of three spots. They also changed how the buy menu looks and feels, along with making it easier to customize and share your crosshair settings with a visual editor.

item.title: FLASHPOINT Season 1 LAN Qualifier teams finalized
item.description: The final qualifier spot has been filled and we now know which eight teams will be going head-to-head in March to earn one of the two spots in FLASHPOINT's first season. They will join the 10 founding team members of FLASHPOINT, which already includes; Cloud9, c0ntact, Dignitas, Gen.G, MAD Lions and MIBR.

item.title: Rainbow Six Tier Rankings: Six Invitational
item.description: What better time to start our Tier Rankings series for Rainbow Six than right after the massive Invitational 2020 event. We have enlisted the help of ANZ-based Caster, Konstantin "Cthulhu" Nuridzhanyan, to place the top Rainbow Six teams from across the globe into tiers based on their recent performances.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 14 Challenges
item.description: "From Russia With Love" - It is time for you to pull out you PP-Bizon and your AK-47 to get some kills. You will be heading to Train a lot as well as dipping your toes into the Demolition gamemode for the first time in this operation.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: BLAST Premier Spring 2020 Season
item.description: With the Holiday Season complete, it was time to start the BLAST Premier Spring Season. For this issue of the Tier Rankings, we have major shake ups in the A and B-Tiers, as well as some debuts that jumped straight into C-Tier on their first performances.

item.title: ESL Ben Green: "[If] HenryG will be up for another shellacking at the hands of Spunj"
item.description: After the announcement of IEM Melbourne 2020 we got to have a quick chat with ESL Australia's Head Account Manager, Ben Green. We talked about the motivations of moving away from Sydney, logistics of the IEM Melbourne 2020 group stages and playoffs, and the possibility of a Caches IV show match.

item.title: Complexity miss out on spot in ESL One Rio Major EU Closed Qualifier
item.description: With the final open qualifier for the Europe section of the ESL One Rio Major completed, we now know the full list of teams that will be fighting for spots in the Europe Minor. Unfortunately, favorite Complexity got pipped at the post by SMASH Gaming and won't be making the appearance.

item.title: YeaH Gaming claims the last two spots in the ESL One Rio Major NA Closed Qualifier
item.description: We already knew the eight teams that were invited to the ESL One Rio Major North American Closed Qualifier, but after four rounds of Open Qualifiers we know the full team list. Yesterday we saw Orgless and YeaH Gaming top off the 16 strong field to be competing next month.

item.title: Melbourne Esports Open 2020 adds Oceanic Pro League Finals and Warcraft
item.description: Just announced, both the League of Legends Oceanic Pro League Finals and Warcraft III: Reforged will be joining the line-up of the Melbourne Esports Open 2020. They sit alongside IEM Melbourne for Counter-Strike and the JB Hi-Fi Game On Zone which returns for the third year.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 13 Challenges
item.description: "Pump Up The Volume" - It is time to get loud as Valve's next set of missions for Operation Shattered Web focuses on making noise. We have Negev kills, M249 kills, breach charges, and just a casual 200 kills in DeathMatch...amoung others.

item.title: IEM Melbourne officially announced for August incl. ticket details and prices
item.description: Today ESL announced that IEM Melbourne will be replacing the yearly Sydney event for 2020. The event will be held in conjunction with the Melbourne Esports Open (MEO) and we have all the details about how tickets will work for both events (incl. prices and sale dates) as well as arena locations.

item.title: 'B Site' league called FLASHPOINT; announces the Teams, Talent, Format, and more!
item.description: Details were trickling out, but now FACEIT have announced their new CSGO League, codenamed 'B Site', as FLASHPOINT. The announcement included the first set of teams participating, the full format, prize money, talent, and that fact the production will "take inspiration from UFC and WWE".

item.title: 5 things FLASHPOINT can learn from the WWE
item.description: When FLASHPOINT was announcing their CSGO league, they said they wanted to "take inspiration from UFC and WWE". The worlds of esports and professional wrestling already have some overlap, but we look at five things that FLASHPOINT could learn from the WWE.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 12 Challenges
item.description: "Maximum Impact" - There is a real mix of mission this week in Operation Shattered Web. We have some about getting MVP awawrds in Competitive, one about kill-streaks in Casual, and one about getting a single kill with the Glock...

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 11 Challenges
item.description: "A Dry Heat" - It is time for everyone to jump into their two favorite maps that look like they are very hot; Mirage and Dust II (including Shortdust). Get some wins in Wingman, kills in Deathmatch, utility damage in Casual and a bunch more.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 10 Challenges
item.description: "Raw Athleticism" - We are almost finished with this operation, but the challenges keep coming out. This weeks we have to get Knife Kills in Arms Race, Utility Damage in Competitive, Aces in Wingman, Default Pistol Kills in Deathmatch, and more.

item.title: Pentanet.GG sign five top Australasian League of Legends players for the OPL
item.description: Today Pentanet.GG, a Perth based esports organisation, announced they have signed five of Australasia's top League of Legends players to compete in the Oceanic Pro League starting on January 31st. The team features players previously on Dire Wolves, ORDER, Bombers, and Legacy Esports.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 9 Challenges
item.description: "Just Having a Good Day" - It is time to hit some nutty shots as this weeks Operation Shattered Web missions all focus on headshots in Guardian, Wingman, and Casual as well as MVPs in Competitive, placing well in Danger Zone, and kill-streaks in Deathmatch.

item.title: OpTic RUSH: "Communication is what [hazed] improved the most for us"
item.description: From the Vault - IEM Sydney 2017. It was Grady's first event as a journalist and he had the chance to talk to RUSH, who was on OpTic Gaming at that point. They talked about hazed as both a player and coach, their first outing in front of the Australian crowd, and OpTic's uncertain future.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 8 Challenges
item.description: "Italian Job" - It is the eighth week of Operation Shattered Web now and we are focusing on a set of maps with similar aesthetics; Canals, Inferno, and Italy.

item.title: Unconfirmed: Renegades to replace DickStacy with Hatz
item.description: The following article is unconfirmed and the combination of facts and observations. What we do know is that Hatz has left ORDER - that has been announced by both the organization and Hatz himself - and that there has been movements in the Renegades camp to indicate that might be where he is heading.

item.title: Unconfirmed: ORDER to pick up Rickeh
item.description: The following article is unconfirmed and the combination of facts and observations. Following on from the fact that Hatz has left, possibly for Renegades (see our other article), that leaves an empty spot on ORDER that needs to be filled.

item.title: Rogue sign Giants Gaming core in time for Pro League Season 11
item.description: Rogue hasn't had a full 5-man roster for Rainbow Six since November last year, but now they are returning just in time for Pro League Season 11. They have signed the core of Giants Gaming and then added a young German talent from OrgLess as their fifth.

item.title: IEM Katowice 2020 invites and Closed Qualifiers teams announced
item.description: Today IEM released a bunch of information about the IEM Katowice 2020 event in February including all of the direct invites and all of the invites for the regional Closed Qualifiers in Europe, North America, Asia, and Oceania.

item.title: juliano and the squad leave Besiktas and add mimi
item.description: Juliano kicked off 2020 with an announcement that her team would no longer be representing Beşiktaş Esports and are now free agents with no contract. This wasn't the only announcement as she also let us know that mimi from Copenhagen Flames Fe would be joining them.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 7 Challenges
item.description: "Hot Shot" - It might be a new year, but it is the same old Counter-Strike. Operation Shattered Web is still ongoing and we have all the week 7 challenges focusing on flashy deagle, headshot, and no-scope kills.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 6 Challenges
item.description: "Money Isn't Everything" - It is Christmas time and Happy Holidays to all, but we have some missions to do! The sixth week of missions for Operation Shattered Web is out and will test us with challenges related to money.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 5 Challenges
item.description: "Field Trip" - It is that time of the week for Valve to drop 6 new challenges on us. It might be the holiday season, but Operation Shattered Web isn't taking any time off. Befriend some chickens, fly with a parachute, and gets kills with a bunch of different weapons.

item.title: All ESL Pro Tour event locations and dates leaked
item.description: Thanks to a hidden image on the ESL Pro Tour website and a few extra pieces of hidden information, we know the locations for every single ESL Pro Tour event in 2020. Images, proof, and all of the details are inside!

item.title: League of Legends comes up big at The Game Awards 2019
item.description: Esports once again center stage during the sixth incarnation of Geoff Keighley's award ceremony. Six awards at the event were dedicated to esports; 'Esports Game of the Year', 'Esports Team', 'Esports Player', 'Esports Coach', 'Esports Event', and 'Esports Host' as voted on by the fans.

item.title: Did we figure out the entire ESL Pro Tour schedule?
item.description: Back in September, ESL announced their Pro Tour with a bunch of information and fancy graphics, but with recent announcements like DreamHack Masters Jönköping and the entire Dreamhack Open circuit - we think we have figured out what every single one of the 2020 events is!

item.title: DreamHack Summer is now DreamHack Masters Jönköping
item.description: Dreamhack Open Summer was missing in yesterdays announcement of all the DreamHack Open CSGO tournaments for next year and now we know why - DreamHack Masters Jönköping 2020 will be taking it's place on the calendar.

item.title: Valve Major is going to Rio de Janeiro
item.description: ESL this morning confirmed that the first CSGO major of 2020 will be hosted by themselves and it will be in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil for the first time! We have all the details and reactions to the big announcement.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: IEM Beijing, EPL Season 10 Finals, ECS Season 7 Finals
item.description: We have had a bunch of top tier tournaments since we last did a Tier Ranking, so it was time to summon Phoebe and Grady! There is quite a few new A-Tier teams and some falls from grace as well this edition.

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 4 Challenges
item.description: "Sniper's Den" - This week the new Shattered Web Operation challenges are focused on the maps Train and Cobblestone, as well as the AWP and SSG 08. What do you have to do? Well, we can tell you that! and then you can get to unlocking everything.

item.title: EPL Day 4: Fnatic and mousesports make it a America-less semifinals
item.description: It was a bad new for North American Counter-Strike fans as both Team Liquid and Evil Geniuses were sent packing by the Europeans. It was an extra bad day for EG fans as well since we managed to see a rare occurrence of a 16-0.

item.title: LoL developer announces third party publishing group, Riot Forge
item.description: Today Riot Games have announced that they are starting a new publishing group to work with third party developers to create some awesome games in the world of League of Legends.

item.title: EPL Day 3: The dream ends for ATK and the Australians
item.description: The final day of the group stage is upon us and that means a lot of teams are going to leave heartbroken and only 6 of them will make it into the playoffs. We have had some of the best matchups today and could see a repeat in the grand finals later on.

item.title: EPL Day 2: ATK send North home and 100T send FaZe home
item.description: Day 2 sees the action continue in Odense with Astralis and Team Liquid fighting for their spots in the playoffs and all of Sharks, North, FaZe, and mibr failing in the Lower Bracket and heading home, which means ATK stays alive for another day.

item.title: 15 of the DreamLeague Season 13 (Leipzig Major) teams finalized
item.description: DreamLeague Season 13 is taking place in January next year and is the second major of the 2019/20 Dota Pro Circuit season so every team wants to be there, but which 15 teams were able to make it through their region's qualifier and will be flying to Leipzig?

item.title: Operation Shattered Web - Week 3 Challenges
item.description: "A Day At The Office" - It is that time of the week and the Shattered Web Operation has rolled into it's new week. This means there is 6 new challenges that have been revealed and for those of you with the Operation Pass, a bunch of new unlocks are possible.

item.title: Rumor Roundup: Dignitas, Gen.G, OG entering CS with new rosters
item.description: We are kicking off a new column with our CSGO Rumor Roundup. We will scour the internet looking for all the rumors around the CSGO scene and round them all up into one article for easy consumption (and yes, we will credit and link the original authors).

item.title: Renegades signs Grayhound Gaming roster ahead of ESL Pro League Finals
item.description: After 100 Thieves took their Australian roster, the Renegades were left without a Counter-Strike team. That was until yesterday, mere hours before the ESL Pro League Grand Finals in Odense when they announced their brand new (slightly used...) squad.

item.title: EPL Day 1: TyLoo and Heroic go home while NaVi and EG are in the playoffs
item.description: The ESL Pro League Season 10 Finals has kicked off with an action packed day. We saw both TyLoo and Heroic sent home without a single game and both Natus Vincere and Evil Geniuses already punch their tickets into the playoffs.

item.title: 22 Racing Series is now on Kickstarter
item.description: Last month we talked about a new Real Time Strategy Racing game coming out of Australia called 22 Racing Series. This week 22RS launched on Kickstarter with the hopes of raising enough funds to add custom mod tools and some other awesome features.

item.title: Halo is crossing over with Counter-Strike
item.description: Today Valve announced that Halo is coming to Counter-Strike: Global Offensive in the form of a in-games items, some of which is exclusive to owners of the Master Chief Collection. Outside of all the Halo goodness, we also got some updates for performance, visibility on Cache, and overhauls to the Studio map.

item.title: CSGO introduces a new case, 3 new weapon collections, and new stickers and graffiti
item.description: In the second part of today's Counter-Strike update, Valve added a bunch of new community content to the game. We have three brand new weapon collections (Norse Collection, St. Marc Collection, Canals Collection), some new stickers, and some new graffiti.

item.title: New Maps and meta-changing weapon updates for Counter-Strike
item.description: In the first part of the update that Valve pushed out today for Counter-Strike, we see the new version of Cache become more widely available, three new maps enter the game, and the highly requested nerf for the SG553 (with some extra unexpected buffs).

item.title: Counter-Strike's new operation - Operation Shattered Web
item.description: It has been 736 days since Operation Hydra ended...and now Valve has decided to grace Counter-Strike once again with a new operation and it is a big one! Equippable T and CT-sided characters, end-of-match screens, 75 new weapons skins, and much more.

item.title: Canberra Havoc Walcott: "We tend to take every game as it comes"
item.description: Canberra Havoc scored an upset over Chiefs Esports Club in the RLCS Season 8 Oceania Finals to secure their spot at the World Championship. Grady sat down and talked to Walcott about forming the team, the mentality of an underdog, and how it feels to be going to his first Worlds.

item.title: Renegades Torsos: "I’d say I’m one of the best mechanical players in the region"
item.description: After going 6-1 in League Play, Renegades easily swept the competition in the RLCS Season 8 Oceania Final to claim a spot at Worlds. We got some time to chat to Torsos about their run in Season 8, the mentality of the three-man unit, and if this is the best roster he has been with.

item.title: League of Legends Tier Rankings: 2019 World Championship
item.description: What better time to start up our Esports Tier Rankings for a second game, League of Legends, than right after one of the biggest esports tournaments of the year - Worlds 2019. Thanks to Ryan "Hullitude" Hull we attempt to take the top teams from all of the regions and sort them into tiers.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: StarSeries, DH Malmo, ESL NY, and Berlin Major
item.description: It has been over 3 months since we published an Esports Tier Rankings for CSGO and there has been some major shake-ups in the competitive scene. Some teams get sold to new organizations, some rookies rise to the top, and some long time names have a fall from grace.
