item.title: Grayhound malta: "I think [whitegurlwasted] enjoyed herself"
item.description: Grayhound Gaming won the Oceania Qualifier for the OMEN Challenger Series 2019 and that means they will be heading to Jakarta for the finals. Right after their win we got to talk to malta about bringing in INS to replace erkaSt, what losing NeiL_Mcs means, and their eXTREMESLAND experience with whitegurlwasted.

item.title: Are Riot Games taking down Hearthstone, Overwatch, and Counter-Strike?
item.description: During their 10-year-anniversary celebration for League of Legends, Riot Games announced a massive amount of things including a fighting game, shooter game, card game, mobile versions of everything, and an anime. We are going to take a closer look at Legends of Runeterra, the card game, and Project A, the shooter game.

item.title: Is 22 Racing Series a racing sim or a kart game? Neither, but also both!
item.description: Thanks to the guys at GOATi Entertainment we had a chance to play 22 Racing Series on a massive screen on the PAX Australia show-floor. So let's take a look at our experience playing the game and what we learned about the aim of the game, how it is feeding into esports, and where it is going to go from here.

item.title: New Case and New Cache in Counter-Strike update
item.description: Valve just released a new update for Counter-Strike: Global Offensive that introduces the new version of Cache into the game as well as a new theme Weapon Case and Sticker Capsule. We take a look at what is inside the cases as the other miscellaneous changes in the update.

item.title: OMEN Challenger Series 2019 - Oceania Qualifier preview
item.description: Next weekend at Armageddon Expo in Auckland, New Zealand we will see teams, that both HLTV and HTT News agree are 4 of the top 5 teams based in the ANZ Region, go head-to-head. They are fighting for the one ANZ spot in the OMEN Challenger Series 2019 Finals in Jakarta.

item.title: How was Comic Con Amsterdam?
item.description: In his recent trip to Europe, Grady took a stop in The Netherlands for Comic Con Amsterdam. In this article he shows you some of the photos he took form the event as well as letting you know about all of the cool things in the Dutch convention.

item.title: BULL: "I’ll keep doing it as long as I’m having fun"
item.description: This week Matthew 'BULL' Pluck walked into the SkyTower in Auckland to compete in the final race of the LetsPlayLive Project Cars 2 Season 3, he had already won the regular season, but was looking to have some fun. We got to talk to BULL about the difference in setups, his real life racing, and how the season went.

item.title: THR MadzieAU: "If there’s an opportunity there, I’ll definitely give it a red hot crack"
item.description: Last night LetsPlay.Live hosted a LAN Final for their Project CARS 2 Season 3. We chatted to the winner on the night of the two Bathurst races, Team Highland Racing's MadzieAU, about racing sims as an esport, the mentality of second place, and where he wants his career to go.

item.title: Astralis device: "What a horrible birthday if we had lost today"
item.description: Immediately following Astralis' historic win at the StarLadder Berlin Major 2019, we got to talk to the Major MVP device. We chatted about what it was like to win three in a row, the overall major playoffs, and what makes Astralis special.

item.title: Vitality NBK-: "We need to keep ourselves out of our comfort zone"
item.description: Back in the New Legends stage, right after Team Vitality secured their top 8 and playoff spot, Grady had a chat to NBK-. They talked about the rocky start in New Challengers, whether they are the #2 in the world, and playing with ZywOo.

item.title: Renegades Liazz: "I was getting ready for Dust2"
item.description: Renegades shocked everyone by taking out ENCE in the quarterfinals of the Berlin Major and advancing to the semifinals. We sat down with Liazz and talk about his professional career, the rough 0-2 start, and a strange bet he made with his teammates.

item.title: Renegades Gratisfaction: "We’re just not going out without a fight"
item.description: Renegades managed to just slide through and send FaZe Clan home from the major. Right after that win, Grady had a chat with Gratisfaction about the teams' performance in recent tournaments, what is currently the mentality of Renegades, and their Vertigo.

item.title: NaVi Boombl4: "It is a new chapter for me, a new role, new friends, new team"
item.description: Natus Vincere just dispatched MIBR in an elimination match after shockingly dropping down to 1-2. We talk to Boombl4 about what went wrong in the early games, his feeling joining NaVi, and playing against teams from your own region.

item.title: NRG tarik: "Shit happens and we got it done either way"
item.description: NRG Esports triumphed over AVANGAR with a 2-0 victory and that means they advance onto the New Legends Stage. Right after their win, Grady got to talk to tarik about advancing to the next stage, the change on in-game leader with stanislaw, and who they are scared of in the next stage.

item.title: Complexity SicK: "I think [Vertigo] is just a really comfortable map for us"
item.description: Immediately following their 2-0 win against TyLoo in the Challenger Stage of the StarLadder Berlin 2019 Major, Grady got to talk to SicK from Complexity Gaming. They talked about Complexity's brand new player oBo, dephh's new in-game leader role, and what went wrong in the first two matches.

item.title: Grady is going to Comic Con Amsterdam!
item.description: One of our writers, Grady, is heading over to Berlin to cover the StarLadder Berlin Counter-Strike Major. While he is over there, thanks to the awesome folks in the Netherlands, he is also going to attend Comic Con Amsterdam!

item.title: Grayhound sico: "We are confident going into all our games in Oz"
item.description: Grayhound Gaming were 1 map win away from making the playoffs at IEM Sydney 2019, but unfortunately they fell short against Fnatic. This was one of the things Grady talked to sico about, they also touched on what happened to the ICON team and being so close to the playoffs.

item.title: eUnited moose: "They can play majors, we get a revamped team"
item.description: At IEM Sydney, Grady got talk to moose from eUnited. Together they talked about the controversial shake-up between themselves and Swole Patrol, how important qualifiers are to a newer team, and their playstyles within the team.

item.title: Liquid Twistzz: "They’re not going to stay the best forever"
item.description: While they were still the number 2 team in the world, Grady had a chat to Twistzz from Team Liquid. They talked about what is happening in the North American scene, having a bye in the middle of a tournament and how long it takes him to do his hair.

item.title: BIG tiziaN: "[LEGIJA] took a last minute flight to Sydney"
item.description: Back in May, before the BIG shuffle - pun intended - Grady got the chance to talk to tiziaN about how XANTARES is slotting into the team and group, what they had to do when he couldn't make it to Sydney, and how he got into Counter-Strike.

item.title: NiP Lekr0: "I don’t think you play the major for the prize pool"
item.description: Straight after losing the 115 round war against Fnatic at IEM Sydney, Grady got to talk with Lekr0 from Ninjas in Pyjamas. They chatted about the mentality of a long series, what it means to play in a major and how some players like to whine on Twitter.

item.title: Renegades Gratisfaction: "Maybe I can hang ornaments from my mustache"
item.description: Grady had a quick chat to fellow Kiwi, Gratisfaction from Renegades at IEM Sydney this year. They talked about what it was like transitioning from Grayhound Gaming to Renegades as well as their miracle run at the Katowice Major.

item.title: ViCi Freeman: "We didn’t prepare a lot"
item.description: Before he joined TyLoo, Grady sat down with ViCi Gaming's Freeman at IEM Sydney 2019 and via a translator they talked about how the different regions play Counter-Strike differently, the team's mentality heading into the tournament and Vertigo.

item.title: Heroic blameF: "I think every team needs a friberg"
item.description: Back at IEM Sydney 2019, Grady had the chance to talk to the in-game leader of Heroic, blameF, about a number of things including; playing with friberg, events having third-party qualifying spots and how he got into Heroic via a phone call from peacemaker.

item.title: SYF zeph: "It’s really good to prove that I’m still able win and beat these top teams"
item.description: Hot off their upset 2-0 victory over Genuine Gaming, Grady sits down with the newly minted player for SYF Gaming, zeph. They talk about what it is like coming in as underdogs, how easy it is to mesh as a team and the process they went through to rebuild the team.

item.title: IEM Chicago 2019 Summary
item.description: With IEM Chicago over, and the United Center cleared out, it's time for a summary of the event.

item.title: Athletico Splicko: "I think [ningy] played phenomenal, he was man of the match for sure"
item.description: Immediately following their massive win, Grady sits down with Splicko from Athletico Esports' Dota 2 team to talk about the LetsPlay.Live event, their super sub ningy, and whether or not they are the best ANZ Dota 2 team.

item.title: IEM Chicago: 5 stories to watch
item.description: The Groups have been set, and IEM Chicago 2019 is nearly upon us. With that said, it is time to take a look at some of the story-lines that will be on display.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: ESL One Cologne
item.description: Team Liquid took out ESL One Cologne 2019 after a hard-fought battle against the French side of Vitality. This win let them take home $1,000,000 and become the second Intel Grand Slam winner, but what did it do for their tier ranking?

item.title: ESL One Cologne Preview - Team Vitality
item.description: Finally, the fantastic French phenomenon of Vitality rounds out our series. We look at some of the best players on the team, their important stats, and how they have been playing just before ESL One Cologne.

item.title: NRG Ethan: "I feel like I’ve definitely matured more as a player over the years"
item.description: Grady had a quick chat with the young-gun from NRG Esports, Ethan. They hit all of the hard topics including; starting off as a young player and maturing, what it was like to add tarik to the roster, and what it is like to play in front of a loud crowd.

item.title: ESL One Cologne Preview - Team Liquid
item.description: Starting the second half of our previews, we have the current top team, Liquid. Since Katowice, Team Liquid has looked nearly unstoppable. They have won 3 of the required 4 tournaments of the Intel Grand Slam.

item.title: ESL One Cologne Preview - FURIA
item.description: The series marches on, this time to follow the upstart Brazilian squad, FURIA. Jamie takes a look at their form coming into ESL One Cologne, as well as some highlight players and ones to keep an eye on.

item.title: ESL One Cologne Preview - ENCE
item.description: The next team in our series is the people's champion, ENCE. Made up of the best 5 Finnish players in Counter-Strike, they have made quite a splash recently - but can they continue on their trip to the top? or will the bubble burst?

item.title: mousesports chrisJ: "I still tried to see it as a job in situations like that"
item.description: Back at IEM Sydney this year Grady got the chance to sit down with chrisJ from mousesports, just as that lineup was beginning. They talked about always being the villains with the crowd, seeing the numerous mousesports rosters grow and the importance of the player break.

item.title: ESL One Cologne Preview - Natus Vincere
item.description: We continue the series going to our unknown among the top teams, Natus Vincere. For the first time since 2013, NaVi will be without Edward, instead replacing him with Kirill 'Boombl4' Mikhailov, the 20 year old Russian previously of Winstrike.

item.title: ESL One Cologne Preview - Astralis
item.description: This series will look at some of the teams of ESL One Cologne, their performance since the Katowice Major, important stats, and things to watch in Cologne.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: ESL Pro League Season 9 and ECS Season 7 Finals
item.description: Both of the big leagues came to a close and had massive LAN Grand Finals showing exactly what teams are ready to bring it just before the major. There were a lot of teams that underperformed and that is reflected in a number of down-ranks in this edition of the Tier Rankings.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: DreamHack Masters, DreamHack Tours and BLAST Madrid
item.description: The premier event this month was DreamHack Masters in Dallas which saw Team Liquid pick up another trophy for the case, ENCE proving to everyone again that they can go toe-to-toe with the big boys, and Astralis no-showing. What has that done to this edition of the tier rankings?

item.title: LPL Project CARS 2 ANZ Championship Season 1 - Grand Final
item.description: This grand final was the culmination of seven weeks worth of racing and thanks to Let's Play Live, Grady was able to attend live at the SKYCITY Theatre. He got to see eight of ANZ's best Project CARS 2 players battle it out on the almighty Bathurst track.

item.title: FaZe AdreN: "[The travel] is affecting my body and my mental health"
item.description: Grady got a chance to talk to AdreN during IEM Sydney when he was still with FaZe Clan about the intensive travel schedule, which teams they are targeting at the next tournament, and what the inside of his hotel room is like.

item.title: BOOT Benkai: "Our issues lie within our bad habits"
item.description: At IEM Sydney, up in the media room, Grady sat down to have a chat with B.O.O.T-dream[S]cape’s Benkai about the Asian Counter-Strike scene, how he got into esports and which other players he would like to play with.

item.title: MIBR FalleN: "The [IEM Sydney] crowd is kind of having its own show"
item.description: Although they didn’t make the grand finals, falling just short against Team Liquid, MIBR’s FalleN was happy to sit down with Grady and have a chat about the crowd and the country in Australia, the recent roster shuffles that failed and playing in the showmatch as ‘Bad FalleN’.

item.title: Blank Roro: "[ORDER] turned up and they played better than us"
item.description: It wasn’t just Counter-Strike at IEM Sydney, as Grady got to sit down with fellow Kiwi and Overwatch Contenders semifinalist, Roro from Blank Esports. They talk about how he got into esports, Blank’s performance in the tournament and living in a team house.

item.title: Liquid EliGE: "I felt confident that we were going to win the whole time"
item.description: After their win against Fnatic in the grand final of IEM Sydney, Team Liquid sat down with the press and we got the chance to talk to EliGE about feeling the glory of winning, the long best-of-five and the first thing he did after winning and lifting the trophy.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: IEM Sydney, DreamHack Rio de Janeiro and BLAST Miami
item.description: Grady has returned home from IEM Sydney and that means it is time for the team to sit down and try to figure out a new set of tier rankings. We have 2 teams dropping out of the rankings and three debuts, one of which is the highest debut of all time.

item.title: Apex Legends Patch 1.1.1: THICC-BOI Balancing
item.description: Recently the developers at Respawn have produced a new patch for Apex Legends and it is the first balancing patch. The out of the box game left two legends (Gibraltar and Caustic) weak when compared to the other legends, the reason being is that their hitboxes are much larger than their comrades.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: StarSeries Season 7, WESG 2018 and BLAST São Paulo
item.description: Post-Major is always an interesting time and right now we have a whole lot of shuffles, for some teams changing the roster core. There has also been a long period where some teams haven't played any tournaments, because of these reasons we have dropped this edition of the rankings down to 25 teams.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Grand Final
item.description: That is all she wrote as the LPL CSGO ANZ Championship Season 1 comes to an end with a nail-biting grand final between AVANT and Ground Zero. Some technical issues plagued Ground Zero, but they still put up a great fight against the top-seed from the round robin stage.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Grand Final (Pre-Game)
item.description: This week Ground Zero pulled out a victory and managed to defeat Breakaway Esports - now they head to the grand finals of the LPL CSGO ANZ Championship to take on AVANT, who were the top team from the round robin stage.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Semifinal
item.description: Last night Ground Zero took on Breakaway Esports to determine which of them will face AVANT in the Grand Finals of the LPL CSGO ANZ Championship. How well did my predictions for the semifinal go? Spoilers: Not great.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Semifinal (Pre-Game)
item.description: Before the semifinal between Ground Zero and Breakaway Esports tonight, we take a look at who is the favourite and who has the advantage in the best-of-three to determine who faces AVANT in the grand finals later this week.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Week 6
item.description: There were some delays due to events within New Zealand, but the final few games of LetsPlayLive's CSGO ANZ Championship were played out over the past few weeks and we now know what three teams will be competing in the playoffs.

item.title: Apex Legends Season 1 Battle Pass: Wild Frontier Update
item.description: Apex Legends has released their first battle pass called Wild Frontier. If you are not up to date with how battle passes work, they allow you to play as normal, and while you rank up you can unlock exclusive rewards.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Week 5
item.description: Never a dull week a in the LetsPlayLive CS:GO ANZ Championship, after the departure of Tainted Minds last week, we see a huge game-changing update this week that affect some of the guns as well as how the losing bonus is calculated.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Week 4
item.description: This week in the LetsPlayLive CS:GO ANZ Championship we see ICON (fka. Tainted Minds) officially withdraw from the league and the fallout from that involving points being handed around and teams to have 2 matches in one day.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: IEM Katowice 2019 Major
item.description: The IEM Katowice 2019 Major just took place and thats it is time for another tier rankings. This time we see only our second ever double-rank-jump as well as some new faces popping into high-tiers and some fan favorites falling down the table.

item.title: NRG Zayt & Ghost Saf: "By far the best format we’ve ever had"
item.description: Taking a break from Counter-Strike, Jamie got the opportunity to talk to the duo of NRG’s Zayt and Ghost Gaming’s Saf, who won the first ESL Katowice Royale. They discuss Fortnite prize-money, the game-breaking bugs and how they came together as a duo.

item.title: Dignitas milk: "We’re the best team here"
item.description: Jamie got to interview Kiara ‘milk’ Makua from the Intel Challenge Katowice winning Dignitas. They covered the tournament, the female professional scene and what is next for Dignitas.

item.title: Renegades Gratisfaction: "We thought we’d just throw [Dust2] in as a curve ball"
item.description: Our Interview Series from Katowice continues with a short chat with Sean ‘Gratisfaction’ Kaiwai about their stay in Poland, the tournament, and the future.

item.title: FaZe rain: "Right now our map pool is kind of weird"
item.description: For our first interview of the IEM Katowice 2019 Major, Jamie sat down with Håvard ‘rain’ Nygaard of FaZe Clan to discuss the Major, the team, and the upcoming schedule.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Week 3
item.description: This week we saw 2 more Mirage games and yet another overtime on Inferno involving Breakaway Esports, but we also had the first forfeit in the tournament dropping us down to only three games as well as some roster shuffles.

item.title: IEM Katowice 2019 - Quarterfinals Day 1 Preview
item.description: The first day of the IEM Katowice Champions Stage is here, and we have two wonderful matches today. We will see three of the top teams in the world and a team well-known for their upsets go head-to-head for only two spots in the Semifinals of the IEM Katowice Major 2019.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Week 2
item.description: LetsPlay.Live's CS:GO ANZ Championship continued along this week with some overtime and some stomping. Also, we see Tainted Minds be acquired and re-branded to ICON Esports, just before their match against AVANT this week.

item.title: fnatic JW: "[We] had nothing to blame really except ourselves"
item.description: After bombing out in the group stages at ESL One New York, James sat down with JW from fnatic to talk about their recent struggles with roster changes, player roles and their performance at the major.

item.title: NRG Brehze: "Not making the major was a huge blow to us"
item.description: NRG Esports had mixed results; failing to qualify for the FACEIT London Major, winning IEM Shanghai and then making it to the semi-finals of ESL One New York. James talks to star player Brehze about possible reasons for this and how it felt to miss the major.

item.title: This Week In... LPL CS:GO ANZ Championship Season 1 - Week 1
item.description: LetsPlay.Live kicked off their CSGO ANZ Championship yesterday staring 8 of the best teams across Australia and New Zealand. The first week of competition saw a rematch of the 2018 grand final with the champions Chiefs taking on the runner-ups Tainted Minds.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - ViCi Gaming
item.description: The final installation of our Road to the Major series is ViCi Gaming. This team underwent a large number of changes over the course of the last half of the year. ViCi split from Flash Gaming to reform ViCi Gaming. They announced their full roster on September 3rd.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - Winstrike Team
item.description: We continue our series of articles with Winstrike Team, a primarily Russian org. In 2018 the team went through huge changes. They acquired the entire Quantum Bellator Fire roster in June before benching all but Kirill 'Boombl4' Mikhailov due to the team's poor performance at the FACEIT London Major in September.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - FURIA Esports
item.description: With today's installation of the Road to the Major series, we head back to the Americas and follow FURIA eSports. After the London Americas Minor Championship, FURIA moved to Miami.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - Grayhound Gaming
item.description: Back to the Asia Minor Championship, we continue with another team from Australia and New Zealand, Grayhound Gaming. The team only had one significant change between London and Katowice.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - NRG Esports
item.description: After a short break, we return to our Road to the Major series with a look at the first qualifiers out of the Americas Minor, NRG Esports. Since the last Major in London, NRG has had no significant changes to the roster, their last player change happening January 15th of 2018 when Ethan 'Ethan' Arnold replaced Allan 'AnJ' Jensen.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - Renegades
item.description: We switch regions with this entry in the series, heading over to the Asia Minor for our first team to qualify out of the region, Renegades! After struggles at the London Major, Renegades had a number of changes.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: IEM Katowice Minors, iBuyPower Masters and ELEAGUE Invitational
item.description: In our first rankings for over a month we see a large amount of movement in every single tier. 7 new teams join the rankings with 6 dropping off the bottom and even the A-Tier is starting to get a little thin with the IEM Katowice Major on the horizon.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - Team Vitality
item.description: We return to Europe for our next entry in the series. Formed primarily from the ashes of the late 2018 French shuffle, Team Vitality replaced Team Envy as one of the two great hopes of French Counter-Strike.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - Team Spirit
item.description: Nearing the halfway mark of the Road to the Major series, we return to CIS to take a look at Team Spirit. The primarily Russian team has had no changes to the roster since their run to the Challenger's Stage in London.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - ENCE
item.description: We continue our series in Europe, with ENCE, the Finnish org that has embraced the EZ 4 ENCE meme. ENCE signed a fully new roster in 2018, starting with former OpTic Gaming player, Aleksi 'allu' Jalli in March. The rest of the team was announced in April, and then in August they hired Slaava 'Twista' Räsänen as coach.

item.title: Road to the Major: Katowice - AVANGAR
item.description: We begin our Katowice Road to the Major series in the CIS region with the first team to qualify out of the Minors, @avangarqz!

item.title: Chasing Astralis | Roster Changes Among Top Teams
item.description: Since 2018's last big tournament, the Counter-Strike world has seen quite an impressive number of roster changes. Of these changes, none of them could have quite as big an impact on the upcoming Major as the changes seen within 3 of the 5 A-Tier teams' active rosters.

item.title: LetsPlay.Live acquire oceanic gaming platform CyberGamer
item.description: Yesterday LetsPlay.Live announced that they have acquired the oceanic esports platform CyberGamer. CyberGamer has been around since 2007 and has been utilized for multiple oceanic region qualifiers, while also hosting ladders, leagues and forums for discussion.

item.title: Team Liquid had a rough 2018
item.description: On July 28th, Epitacio 'TACO' de Melo became the 4th Team Liquid player across CSGO and LoL in the last year to learn of the death of one of their parents. The unfortunate six month span started with the tragic murder of the mother of their League of Legends ADC, Yiliang 'Doublelift' Peng.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: EPL Season 8 Finals, DreamHack Winter and SuperNova Malta
item.description: This week we saw Astralis win $1,000,000 for the Intel Grand Slam to continue their dominance on top of the mountain. We also had another DreamHack event as well as SuperNova Malta over in St Julian's. This week we also see for the first time only 29 teams entering the tier list.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: ECS Season 6 Finals, DreamHack Atlanta and Toyota Masters
item.description: Astralis got to show once again why they are the undisputed, reigning, defending champions of Counter-Strike right now by taking out the ECS Season 6 finals this past weekend. That wasn't the only tournament effecting the rankings this edition as we also had DreamHack Atlanta and the Toyota Masters in Bangkok.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: IEM Chicago, BLAST Copenhagen and cs_summit
item.description: Three huge events happened these past few weeks with IEM taking a visit to Chicago, BLAST hosting an event in Copenhagen and finally cs_summit having the third iteration of their local-feeling event. We saw two new teams emerge onto the playing field and our rankings.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: EPICENTER and StarSeries i-League Season 6
item.description: We missed the last ranking so there was a lot to be taken into consideration for this one. Post-major events are always interesting as we see a lot of teams falling off the charts and others jumping to take the open spots, but how much did that shift out tiers? Spoilers: A lot.

item.title: WUGS partners with Ginx Esports TV for NBA 2k19 NZ Masters
item.description: We just received news from Tom Featonby of Waikato United Gaming Society about a brand new NBA2k19 tournament in partnership with Ginx Esports TV to be hosted online for New Zealand players for both Xbox One and PlayStation 4.

item.title: mousesports Oskar: "I am just trying to play my old game"
item.description: Our @PalmtopPitbull caught up with @CSGOoskar after the semifinal win over NRG at @ESLCS One New York

item.title: Astralis zonic: "We are heavily inspired by some of the things from traditional sports"
item.description: After Astralis won the FACEIT London Major by beating Natus Vincere 2-0 in the grand finals, and before the confetti had time to settle, we were backstage talking to the coach behind the winning side. zonic gave us a lot of interesting insights while toting his brand new medal.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: FACEIT London Major, also DreamHack Montreal
item.description: The FACEIT Major was held this past week in London and we have to take all three stages of that into account as well as a smaller tournament hosted by DreamHack up in Montreal - There was some huge rank moves this time!

item.title: Astralis dupreeh: "It was kind of unreal in a way having won 16-0"
item.description: At the FACEIT London Major we got to have some time to talk to Astralis player dupreeh about the 16-0 win against MIBR, how the major/legend system could be improved and the Kjaerbye/Magisk situation.

item.title: Breakaway Esports signs CSGO players from Rise & Grind
item.description: Just now Breakaway Esports, backed by the NZ Breakers, have unveiled their brand new Counter-Strike team featuring the players from Rise & Grind. The team joins players from the FIFA, TEKKEN and Hearthstone competitive communities in the orange and blue representing Breakaway.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: DreamHack Masters Stockholm & ZOTAC Cup Masters
item.description: Last time there was no shift in our rankings - this time after ZOTAC Cup Masters and a shocking DreamHack Masters Stockholm finale we see two new teams debut in the rankings as well as five teams shifting around in the ranks!

item.title: Road to the Major - Rogue
item.description: We head to North America to start the beginning of the end of our Road to the Major series. Our first team from the North American Minor is Rogue. The team has been under the guidance of veteran Spencer 'Hiko' Martin since August 2017.

item.title: Road to the Major - compLexity
item.description: Our Road to the Major series ends in North America with compLexity. The core of the team has been together since July 2017, but both Peter 'stanislaw' Jarguz and Shahzeeb 'ShahZaM' Khan joined this April.

item.title: Road to the Major - OpTic Gaming
item.description: Today we move our Road to the Major series to the European Minor with OpTic Gaming. This entire roster was put together in 2018 between February and April.

item.title: Road to the Major - Ninjas in Pyjamas
item.description: The second team we cover from the European Minor is the legendary organization of Ninjas in Pyjamas. Though Patrick 'f0rest' Lindberg and Christopher 'GeT_RiGht' Alesund have been with the team since 2012, every other member has been added since June 2017.

item.title: Kiwi LAN Ping Zero 51 releases more event details
item.description: Ping Zero is a staple in New Zealand and is our biggest LAN event across the country. This year at Ping Zero 51 is aiming to get 300+ gamers over the three day event to attend and play a mix of competitive tournaments and mix around with other gamers from all over New Zealand. We have some of the tournament details for you!

item.title: Road to the Major - Team Spirit
item.description: Our Road to the Major series moves to the CIS Minor with Team Spirit. With the exception of Victor 'somedieyoung' Orudzhev, this team's roster has been together since June of 2016. That roster is:

item.title: Road to the Major - HellRaisers
item.description: Our Road to the Major series continues in the CIS Minor with HellRaisers. Though Vladyslav 'bondik' Nechyporchuk was loaned to TyLoo for a short period, this team has been together since August, 2017. The roster consists of:

item.title: Road to the Major - Renegades
item.description: We continue the Road to the Major series with Renegades. This team qualified through the Asia Minor Championship and has had the same roster since February of this year.

item.title: Breakaway Esports signs Kiwi players DanBanter and Jakattack
item.description: After launching just over two weeks ago with members Hazz, LoriiPops and FIFA/NBA2K player airbrn, Breakaway Esports has made another talent acquisition. This time they look to the fighting game community for TEKKEN7 player DanBanter and a successful Hearthstone player in Jakattack.

item.title: Road to the Major - TyLoo
item.description: The start of the Road to the Major series begins with Chinese org TyLoo. They are the kings of the Chinese scene, however their international success has been limited at best. The current roster, which has been together since January 18th of this year, is as follows:

item.title: NZ Breaker's launch Breakaway Esports
item.description: Whispers were circulating around the New Zealand esports scene this week and now the NZ Breakers, New Zealand's national basketball team, have officially announced they are stepping into the world of esports.

item.title: IEM Chicago announced - Invites, Dates and On-Air Talent
item.description: After rumors circulating this week about IEM Oakland being replaced with IEM Chicago for 2018, this morning ESL came out and made the announcement along with 8 of the 10 invited teams, all the on-air talent and the dates.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: ELEAGUE Premier & IEM Shanghai
item.description: #ELEAGUEPremier saw 8 of the top teams in #CSGO go head-to-head and nothing out of the ordinary happened, then #IEMShanghai just ended and again nothing shocked us or shook up the rankings #Esports

item.title: Australia Esports Federation announce CS:GO Season 1 tournament
item.description: The Australia Esports Federation (AEF) announced they will be running their first ever Counter-Strike tournament. The AEF are known around Australia for their DOTA 2 tournaments, but are looking to the Oceanic region for CSGO players to compete.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: FACEIT London Minors & DreamHack Valencia
item.description: After a long stretch we now know which eight teams will be heading to London for the FACEIT Major from the CIS, Europe, Americas and Asia minors. We also know that North took out DreamHack Valencia after a tight final battle against underdogs Luminosity Gaming.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: ESL One Cologne
item.description: One of the biggest tournaments of the year, ESL One Cologne has just ended and that means an update to our tier rankings with some massive shake-ups from the unexpected results in the Cathedral of Counter-Strike. There is also a bunch of smaller qualifiers and tournaments to take into account.

item.title: LetsPlay.Live announce Tekken 7 World Championship NZ Qualifier
item.description: Once again Kiwi esports organizer LetsPlay.Live are stepping up in a huge way for all New Zealand-based fighting game players - now they get a shot at the 2018 IESF - International Esports Federation Esports World Championship in Kaohsiung!

item.title: MiBR sign ex-SK Gaming and other changes (9 June - 23 June)
item.description: We're reviving an old column in light of this year's rather volatile roster changes. This will be done weekly, but only in weeks where relevant roster changes have taken place. This week's installment will be a special covering the last 2 weeks.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: ESL Belo Horizonte, CSGO Asia Champs & DreamHack Summer
item.description: It was a big weekend of Counter-Strike with three huge top-tier LANs all going on at once. We had ESL over in Belo Horizonte, Perfect World in Asia for the CSGO Asia Championships and DreamHack in Jönköping for DreamHack Open Summer 2018 - so there has been a lot of movement on our tier rankings.

item.title: The Elite def. The New Day...in Street Fighter
item.description: We never thought we would see the day when a professional wrestling stable from WWE called The New Day would wind up facing a stable from NJPW called The Elite. New IWGP Heavyweight Champion Kenny Omega would face Xavier Woods (aka. Austin Creed) in Street Fighter at E3.

item.title: GODSENT Roster Sold to Red Reserve
item.description: Red Reserve, a team that dissolved their previous roster last month, has purchased the entire roster of GODSENT. The team was being sold by owners Markus Wallsten and Tomas Oropesa. RFRSH Entertainment, while not owners, operated and managed the team for the pair of owners.

item.title: CZ-75, M4A1-S, Mirage and Canals changed in new CSGO update
item.description: Just now a new update dropped for Counter-Strike: Global Offensive that contains changes to both the CZ-75 and M4A1-S weapons, as well as changes for the Mirage and Canals maps.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: ECS Season 5 & Moche XL Esports
item.description: This past week included two tournaments that had top teams; the ECS Season 5 Finals with the top four teams from each of the EU and NA conferences going head-to-head and a smaller tournament held in Lisbon called Moche XL Esports that featured HellRaisers and SK Gaming as well as major legends Quantum Bellator Fire.

item.title: All Blacks and Black Ferns players on first episode of The Night Squad
item.description: LetsPlay.Live have announced the first three guests for their new show "The Night Squad" and it features three famous Kiwi sports players on the All Blacks and Black Ferns.

item.title: IEM Sydney online viewership up 75%
item.description: ESL have announced that IEM Sydney's online viewership has seen a massive increase of 75% from last year with 13.5 million unique viewers tuning in and that over 7,500 people attended the live event each day.

item.title: CSGO Tier Rankings: StarSeries i-League & DreamHack Austin
item.description: This is the first in what will become a regular segment on Esports Kingdom. Grady and Jamie get together after every major LAN and instead of ranking the teams based on their recent performance, they place their top 30 teams into tiers with other teams at their skill-level.

item.title: LetsPlay.Live launching new series called 'The Night Squad'
item.description: LetsPlay.Live is launching a brand new series on Twitch called "The Night Squad"! It will be hosted by kiwi gaming personality HelloMissPotter and feature celebrities from throughout New Zealand such as sports stars, comedians, musicians and TV personalities.

item.title: Gfinity Elite Series AU CSGO kicks off this weekend
item.description: This weekend is the first round of play for the brand new Gfinity Elite Series AU league. It will be streamed live on Twitch each weekend for 6 weeks from the Gfinity Arena in Sydney with 6 of the top Australian teams going head-to-head each week. First up, lets look at the six teams that you see play in the league.

item.title: Astralis Magisk: "There is no reason to fix something that is not broken"
item.description: Esport Kingdom's first interview from Dallas came with Astralis' Emil "Magisk" Reif. James Wert sat down with him on Friday to ask a few short questions. Astralis qualified for the Semifinals by winning the Upper Bracket Final in Group Red over Team Liquid on Day 3 of Groups.

item.title: Legacy LONS: "I think [Grayhound] are better than Renegades to be honest"
item.description: They were a last minute invite but Legacy's Kiwi boy LONS took some time to talk to us. We chatted about being from New Zealand, getting to scrim against the international teams after the tournament and the best teams in the Australian scene right now.

item.title: SK boltz: "I know I am not playing the best I can"
item.description: After a disappointing result at IEM Sydney, SK Gaming's player boltz talks to us about the surprise that was the Australian teams, the internet hate directed towards him and adapting to Stewie2K and using English for the calls.

item.title: MVP XigN: "I realized that strategy and tactics were not everything"
item.description: MVP PK attended IEM Sydney and were heading to Dallas for ESL Pro League right after, but we got some time with XigN and with the help of MPV's coach termi were able to have a short interview.

item.title: Astralis Magisk: "Our map pool is probably the best in the world right now"
item.description: Fresh off their IEM Sydney dominance and just before their semifinal against mousesports we got to talk to Astralis' MVP of the tournament, Magisk. We chat about; coming into a top team, Astralis' current wave of momentum and their huge map pool.

item.title: Chiefs sterling: "It sucks that we wont be able to play in Valve majors"
item.description: At IEM Sydney we got to talk to sterling from the Chiefs ESC, sadly the video died...but we will make do! sterling and I chatted about the Australian scene, professional players with VAC bans and the new LetsPlay.Live arena inside the SkyTower.

item.title: Fnatic Lekr0: "We dont help each other ingame if we play a bad game before"
item.description: At IEM Sydney Fnatic's Lekr0 took some time out of the weekend to sit down (actually stand up) and have a chat to us about their performance in the tournament, the false reports around replacing Golden and what their plans are heading into the ECS Finals.

item.title: ESL Pro League Season 7 Finals - Day 5 (Semifinals)
item.description: The Grand Final teams are set, but first let's review what happened over the course of Day 5 during the Semifinals!

item.title: Grayhound Gratisfaction: "Now we know we can compete with the worlds best"
item.description: "Grat woulda hit that" and Gratisfaction did have a chat with us at IEM Sydney about his team, the rise of the Australian scene in Counter-Strike and Grayhound Gaming's surprise upsets against SK Gaming and FaZe Clan.

item.title: ESL Pro League Season 7 Finals - Day 4 (Quarterfinals)
item.description: The fourth day in the scorching Texas heat has been wrapped up, so let's recap the day to get you ready for the Semifinals!

item.title: ORDER aliStair: "Australia is not a joke, we can compete with everybody"
item.description: ORDER only entered the Counter-Strike scene in January, they have already competed in two international LANS with IEM Katowice and IEM Sydney. We sat down with one their players aliStair to talk about the Australian scene, the rapid rise to success and an infamous tweet that he sent from INS' account.

item.title: mousesports ropz: "Online matches take up a lot of time [...] less time for practice"
item.description: ropz who represents Estonia in the international team mousesports made it all the way to the semifinals. He then talked to us about representing his country, being the villain on enemy soil and mousesports' goals heading to Dallas for ESL Pro League.

item.title: ESL Pro League Season 7 Finals - Group Stage Day 3
item.description: And here is the second part of the mega-article, this time covering Day 3 and everything you need to know before the playoffs tomorrow!

item.title: ESL Pro League Season 7 Finals - Group Stage Day 2
item.description: Apologies for missing Day 2 recap, as I was preparing for/traveling to Dallas. Therefore, both my day 2 and day 3 recaps will be coming out today!

item.title: RFRSH Entertainment and GODSENT Ownership
item.description: [AMENDED 5/17] On May 13th, Richard Lewis released a video on Valve's new Conflict of Interest rule which is being implemented for the upcoming FaceIt London Major and the Qualifiers. The rule is very similar to the WESA Multi-team Ownership rule that was announced in March of 2017.

item.title: ESL Pro League Season 7 Finals - Group Stage Day 1
item.description: The first day of group play is over in the sweltering heat of Dallas, and for the most part, it went according to script. Let's dive right in!

item.title: ESL Pro League Season 7 Finals - Group Red Preview
item.description: The ESL Pro League regular season is all wrapped up, IEM Sydney is over, and the next stop on the LAN circuit is the Verizon Theater for those teams that qualified for the Pro League Finals.

item.title: TyLoo BnTeT: "Our communication is not 100%, maybe 90%"
item.description: Fresh off defeating teams like SK Gaming and Cloud9 in the IEM Sydney group stages we talk to star player of the Chinese team TyLoo, BnTeT, about his team, their performance and the Asian scene as a whole.

item.title: FaZe karrigan: "We are a very good team no matter who we put in as the fifth player"
item.description: After they won IEM Sydney we got to have a chat to the ingame-leader of FaZe Clan about their win, how Xizt is working out, and the Australian teams that did well against them in the groups.

item.title: ESL Pro League Season 7 Finals - Group Yellow Preview
item.description: The ESL Pro League regular season is all wrapped up, IEM Sydney is over, and the next stop on the LAN circuit is the Verizon Theater for those teams that qualified for the Pro League Finals.

item.title: IEM Sydney Group Stage Day 1 Predictions
item.description: IEM Sydney is kicking off today in the ESL Studios with Group A and Group B playing their initial BO1 matches as well as Group A's second round BO3 games in the upper and lower brackets.

item.title: Dust2 appearing at two upcoming ESL events
item.description: ESL have announced that the previous active duty map pool change of removing Cobblestone and adding Dust2 will take place before two major upcoming tournaments hosted by them. The first game of which is scheduled to be played in less than a week.

item.title: ESL Pro League Season 7 Week 7 Preview: Europe
item.description: Season 7 of the ESLCS Pro League is fast coming to a close. The last week of the regular season, Week 7, takes place April 24th-26th. That means we have to take a look at each region and determine who is most likely to make it to the Finals in Dallas, May 18th-20th. Yesterday I covered North America, so today's installment focuses on Europe.

item.title: DreamHack Masters Marseille Semifinals and Grand Final Summary
item.description: The Grand Finals are over at Dreamhack Masters Marseilles in Le Dôme de Marseilles. Congratulations to Astralis on not only winning the Grand Finals, but taking NaVi to the woodshed. They look well poised for the next couple upcoming LAN's.

item.title: Team Yeah Nah Wins 2018 AUNZ Splatoon 2 Cup
item.description: After a month of splatting at the highest level across Australia and New Zealand, the two Splatoon 2 top-ranked teams came together for the 2018 AUNZ Splatoon 2 Cup’s grand finale in Melbourne this past weekend. After a thrilling grand final at Supanova Melbourne, it was team Yeah Nah who came out on top with a 5-0 victory.

item.title: DreamHack Masters Marseille Quarterfinals Summary and Predictions
item.description: The Quarterfinals are done on day 4 of Dreamhack Masters Marseille at Le Dôme de Marseille. I went 1-3 on the day, for a record of 5-5 over 3 days of Best of 3's.

item.title: DreamHack Masters Marseille Day 3 Summary and Quarterfinals Predictions
item.description: Day 3 is done and dusted at Le Dôme de Marseille, and it was as entertaining as it was depressing for some. I went 2-2 on the day, for a record of 4-2 over Day 2 and 3.

item.title: DreamHack Masters Marseille Day 2 Summary and Day 3 Predictions
item.description: Day 2 has wrapped up at Le Dôme de Marseille, and none of the results were extremely surprising. Also note, I was 4-0 on picks in yesterday's Day 1 summary and Day 2 preview and every team that won their group's second game yesterday won today's match.

item.title: DreamHack Masters Marseille Day 1 Summary and Day 2 Predictions
item.description: Day 1 at Le Dôme de Marseille is over, and we had a few surprises, some close games, and some absolutely one-sided affairs. Let's take a look at each Group and where they stand after the best of 1's.

item.title: ESL Pro League Season 7 Week 7 Preview: North America
item.description: With Season 7 of the ESLCS Pro League closing in on the last week of its regular season, it is time to take a look at each of the regions and see who is most likely to make it to the Finals in Dallas, May 18th-20th. In this first installment, North America is the focus. NA Week 7 takes place April 24th-26th.

item.title: LetsPlay.Live announce Project CARS NZ Championship
item.description: Buckle up for Esports Racing at its fastest. This May, LPL is putting NZ back in the driver’s seat, bringing you the Project Cars NZ Championship! If you think you have what it takes, you could be in for a share of $10,000 NZD and the title of New Zealand’s fastest racer.

item.title: Lexicon of Lore launches as The Idiots Lantern retires
item.description: It has been announced that The Idiots Lantern, who we had previously sourced interviews from, will be as of today rebranded as the Lexicon of Lore and switching focus away from entertainment and gaming and towards story and lore videos.

item.title: FACEIT Major 2018 qualification details announced
item.description: This morning as well as ticket details FACEIT also revealed the qualifier details and structure to get yourself into the SSE Arena in Wembley and compete with the world's best Counter-Strike teams.

item.title: FACEIT London Major release tickets
item.description: FACEIT have announced the prices and tiers of tickets available for their Counter-Strike major tournament on September 20-23 live from the SSE Arena in Wembley.

item.title: All of the Brigitte, Overwatch's new hero, skins
item.description: Back on the last day in February Blizzard graced us with the announcement of a brand new hero called Brigitte. She is a support class character that can heal, provide armor and do damage to multiple opponents at once with her Rocket Flail. Lets look at her skins!

item.title: Fortnite releases V2.3 update with 20v20v20v20v20 mode
item.description: Fortnite released a patch for PS4, Xbox One and PC today that marks version 3.2 and carries a brand new 20v20v20v20v20 gamemode for Battle Royale as well as a new hero called Wukong, Easy Anti-Cheat and various bug fixes.

item.title: FACEIT announces Australasia Pro League for Oceania players
item.description: FACEIT announced this morning that Oceania players will have a Hub to play in the Australasia Pro League - the project is the brain-child of James "JAMES" Quinn and Iain "Snyper" Turner. There is divisions for every skill level from Skill Level 1 - 10.

item.title: Matthew Kemp: "It is a different experience of RuneScape"
item.description: The Idiots Lantern got to talk to the Senior Product Manager of Old School RuneScape, Matthew Kemp (aka. Mod Mat K). They talked about a range of things from the game's fifth anniversary, to RuneScape Mobile and his origin story of how he got involved with RuneScape and the job with Jagex.

item.title: LPL Arcade Reborn Dragon Ball FighterZ Regional Top 8s
item.description: LetsPlay.Live are currently hosting their Arcade Reborn Tour starting off with Dragon Ball FighterZ, taking the game into four different cities all around New Zealand to find the best fighter and give them a shot at EVO 2018.

item.title: Nuke gets a major overhaul in new CSGO update
item.description: While everyone was busy watching the cs_summit2 tournament, Valve was being sneaky beaky and dropping a new update. This update included a major overhaul for the active duty map Nuke, update for the map Canals and small improvements all around.

item.title: Overwatch League Week 2 results and rankings
item.description: The second week of Blizzard's esports league for Overwatch has come to an end with three teams still undefeated and two yet to even pick up a win. We take a look at the winners and losers this week and how that had changed the standings.

item.title: 3 more invites for IEM Katowice and NA & EU qualifier invites
item.description: Today ESL revealed three more teams that will be attending IEM Katowice PUBG Invitational as well as the eight teams for the NA and the eight teams for the EU closed qualifiers who will each go up against eight teams from the open qualifiers.

item.title: IEM Sydney is returning for 2018
item.description: ESL has been quiet ever since May of last year where they rocked the Qudos Bank Arena in Sydney with 7,000 attendees each day. But thanks to a post by EEAA (Exhibition & Event Association of Australia) we now know that the event will be back for 2018 and a few details.

item.title: ESL announce 3 invites and qualifier details for IEM Katowice
item.description: ESL have been busy all over social media generating hype for their Intel Extreme Master Katowice event and the huge PUBG Invitational taking place. Today they announced three of the nine invited teams and the dates/format for the qualifiers.

item.title: SK coldzera: "We go a lot to cheesecake factory"
item.description: SK Gaming's coldzera, the number one Counter-Strike: Global Offensive player for the second year in the row, sat down and did an AMA on r/GlobalOffensive and answered various questions between practicing for the ELEAGUE Boston 2018 Major.

item.title: Fortnite's V2.2.0 update brings a new map updates and much more
item.description: Fortnite patch V.2.2.0 is scheduled to release on January 18th, just when the Battle Royale Winter event comes to an end. The update includes new map updates for Battle Royale, battle pass bonuses and various patches to both Battle Royale and Save The World.

item.title: 100 Thieves out of ELEAGUE Boston 2018 Counter-Strike major
item.description: 100 Thieves just announced on their Twitter that due to visa issues their team cannot compete in Boston for the ELEAGUE Counter-Strike major in the following weeks. ELEAGUE have released a statement about the empty slot left in the tournament.

item.title: Aegislash and Blastoise coming to Pokkén Tournament DX
item.description: In the Nintendo Direct Mini today we got to learn about a new Battle pack for Pokken Tournament DX featuring two new Battle Pokémon and four new Support Pokémon available for purchase right now in the Nintendo eShop on Nintendo Switch.

item.title: ESL announce the ESL AU&NZ Championship 2018 Season
item.description: ESL returns to the Australian and New Zealand scenes in 2018 with two huge seasons expanded to sixteen teams each and branching out into DOTA 2. The CSGO stage will feature a price pool of $20,000 and the online league will be run over seven weeks.

item.title: IEM Katowice 2018 reveal new CS:GO tournament format
item.description: Intel® Extreme Masters World Championship Katowice 2018 will be like no other IEM before. For the first time in IEM's history, we will see 16 CS:GO teams competing in the tournament. With the new number of teams we have created a new format that is different from the previous 12-team format.

item.title: EGAA launches - New ANZ esports peak body
item.description: Today we announce the formulation of EGAA - Esports Games Association of Australia and New Zealand, a unifying peak body for the esports industry.

item.title: 'The Rad Scientist' Dr. Coyle joins ARMS + New Party Crash
item.description: Today’s launch of version 5.0 adds another playable pugilist in the form of Dr. Coyle, bringing the total roster to 15 characters, including stalwarts Master Mummy and Twintelle who will duke it out in the next online Party Crash event happening from Saturday 30th December.

item.title: Faker, Cloud9 and Overwatch come up big at The Game Awards 2017
item.description: Esports took center stage during the fourth incarnation of Geoff Keighley's award ceremony. Three awards at the event were dedicated to esports; 'Best eSports Game', 'Best eSports Team' and 'Best eSports Player' as voted on by the fans.

item.title: Fast cars and racing pods! - Let's Play Live GT Sport
item.description: Thanks to Let's Play Live, Grady was able to attend the Gran Turismo Sport event at the SKYCITY Theatre. There was some awesome cars to look at and some great players and celebrities playing in racing pods to try and get the best times on the Bathurst track.

item.title: DEVIL to Team LDLC and other changes (19 June - 25 June)
item.description: There has been a lot of roster movement in professional Counter-Strike scene in the past ten days both worldwide and in the Oceania region with new teams being formed, old teams being dropped and players switching teams.

item.title: Astralis kjaerbye: "One game at a time and just play our hearts out"
item.description: Astralis may not have made it to the grand final of IEM Sydney, but they still put on a great showing making it to the semi-finals in the big stage. At the event Grady got to have a chat with star player kjaerbye about sightseeing in Australia and his preferred finals format.

item.title: SK fer: "It is an incredible crowd and they love this game"
item.description: After the grand finals at the Intel Extreme Masters Sydney tournament, Grady got to sit down with tournament winner fer to talk about SK Gaming's preparation coming into the tournament, hot off a win at cs_summit, and the best-of-five final against FaZe Clan.
